This was an early flight to get to work, AA had recently sent me an email that they would upgrade my status to Platinum for 3 months so that I could experience the benefits of it. On this flight I did not make it for the business class upgrade, I believe I was like 10 on the list, however I got a seat with more leg room for no extra cost. I got to Miami from Philadelphia with no issues, the plane was clean and the crew professional. Good job AA!

Kansas City to Philadelphia. I honestly wouldn't fly American if they didn't go everywhere I have to go. They are over priced for what you get. They are just as bad as Spirit as they charge you for seats. How dare you! What am I suppose to do, stand? If you're not first class they make you feel like nothing. Thanks. Delta, Southwest, Virgin, JetBlue are so much better! These are my last flights on this airline.

Tampa to Philadelphia. Horrible experience. Flight overbooked, forced everyone with a carry on to become checked bag. Pilot said 15'minutes remain, ended up being 45. Once we got off the plane, checked bags were sent to wrong pickup location.

Orlando to Miami. Rude completely unhelpful at desk. Almost missed flight. Then disrespectful again when another passenger cut the line for the second time. Bet if I was a man or traveling with one he wouldn't have snapped at me. Worst flight experience ever. Won't be returning!

Phoenix to Minneapolis. Worst customer service ever. Was traveling this evening (see picture - no one was allowed into the check in area despite no line). Stood next in line to check in bag for 40 minutes and was 3 minutes late to check my bag and told I couldn't board my flight. When I asked for an explanation, one was not given. I was put on a standby flight with no guarantees seat for the following day again with no explanation. The lady helping me laughed when I walked away - clearly this was a joke to her. Now I'm stuck without a reservation despite paying for a ticket and waiting NEXT IN LINE for 40 minutes. Will never fly American again. Highly recommend flying southwest. American air lines at Phoenix sky harbor ALWAYS has customer service issues. Do not support this airline.

Charlotte to Tampa. I was on flight 1773 and my seat was 18B. We had not taken off yet and I had a seizure. It was the first seizure I had in a year. The staff was great and the people around me were great. The steward in particular that stands out whose name I did not get because we just boarded and it was so crazy. He was so amazing and patient and helpful. He got all my stuff for me and made me feel comfortable during my seizure. I wasn't rushed off the plane or felt embarrassed. The staff and other customers on the flight were so understanding and great. The flight was already delayed and my situation was making it worse and everyone was really great with me. Thank you and please tell that flight attendant from the bottom of my heart thank you!

Dallas to Lexington. I would recommend paying a little more money to fly with someone else. I've had problems every time I've flown with American and this past time has been a nightmare. First they do a surprise landing somewhere else, making all of us miss our other flights. They wouldn't let me on my next one until I argued with them for a while and after they let me and others on they take us all the way to a 30 min take off spot only to take us back bc they decide to cancel it. Had to stay the night in the airport and was supposed to take off on another flight at 12, but only to have them have us get off bc technical issues. They get us another plane, we board, and they tell us to get off again bc technical. They obviously don't care about their customers bc they won't pay attention or do anything for wasting 2 days of our lives.

Pittsburgh to Phoenix. Horrible customer service. Due to business I called in to move a flight back willing to pay as I have always done with Southwest Airlines. American was unable to accommodate me in any matter and advised me to buy another round trip ticket as my entire trip would be a total loss. There was no credit or any type of refund offered and on top of that they were the rudest people I have spoken to.

Cancun to Omaha via Miami. Absolutely dreadful experience. A nightmare. Flight delayed 5 times without any explanation, stuck in the airport for 6 hours, spent 80$ on food and internet to let family know. On arrival in Miami they throw us on the street without explanation how to get to shuttle to Holiday Inn hotel in the middle of the night. I was forced to take another flight to Chicago, arrive to Omaha a day later, miss my work. I didn't pay for this. I paid for 5 hours 52 min flight with one connection. It was cattle treatment at the airport. I truly hope they go out of business.

St. Louis to Dallas via Tampa. They never let me know my flight changed. The people at the desk were rude and unhelpful. Now i will miss a very important business meeting because I can't get a flight until the morning. I will never catch an American Airlines flight again.

Oklahoma City to Tampa. It is very frustrating that the majority of flyers take on 2 and even 3 carry on items. Most of them are large and need to be checked. We check our bags everytime we fly and are charged 25 bucks per bag. But, the people that don't check their bags and are forced to check them at the plane don't get charged a dime. There was a girl on our flight 3 days ago that carried on a duffle bag that was bigger than her. It didn't fit in the overhead compartment and it didn't fit under her seat. She had her feet on top of it the entire flight and no one said anything to her. All of this "not checking bags" also holds up the entire plane and with short connection times we have made very close calls of almost missing our connecting flights. This is a very frustrating and unfair system that needs to be taken care of immediately.

New York JFK to Sao Paulo and back in business class was a flawless flight. AA's lounges on both ends have been renovated, while they won't win design awards, they are spacious and comfortable. At JFK, there is actually real champagne (let's hope that won't be cost reduced)

Tampa to Charlotte. Absolute worst airline. Had to take emergency military leave to attend my grandfathers funeral. Was told by employee on the phone to buy a later in day ticket to save money and was assured multiple times that my ticket was available to be put on stand by for earlier flights. Arrived at TPA, only to be told by multiple employees that it wasnt eligible to be placed on stand by. So yes I know this is partly on myself for being ignorant enough to buy a later ticket. However, due to the dishonesty on the part of the sales representative and refusal to listen by the airport employees I missed my own grandfathers funeral. Really appreciate that AA. If I could give you a negative 10, I would.

Kona to Phoenix. Awful experience on an aging, dirty poorly equipped plane. Seat had almost no room, very narrow. The legroom even though I paid for extra was awful and inadequate. The graphic showed when you select your seat was inaccurate and did not represent the leg room available on the plane. I got no satisfaction when I complained to AA. I'm even an AA Advantage credit card member, have a frequent flyer account as well and that meant nothing to them.

Charlotte to Boston. Was supposed to leave at 10:20 pm, got postponed three times without any information. I was traveling with my kids one is 4 years old and the other 6 months old, we did not start boarding till after midnight and the staff were very rude and evasive when you ask for information. This airline is getting much worse, this is not my first bad experience, I am considering even canceling the credit card I have with American Airlines, not interested in their miles, very disappointed and frustrated. That leg of the trip just ruined all the fun we had on our vacation.

Gulfport to Dallas. I am sitting at the airport with another delayed flight. It has become way more normal for a flight delay than on time. Particularly with AA! Our flight is now 7 hours past due and still isn't here. Also, they are not giving us updates. It is 10 minutes past the last updated departure time and no news at all. I recommend flying with anyone but AA. The â€œsavingsâ€ isn't worth it when you have to plan a full day early to allow for repeated delays. I'm done with American Airlines.

Los Angeles to Chicago. There is too many seats in the airplane and no one have any space. Everyone is sitting and touching another person every time you want to move. The tables are dirty so as carpet in many places. I have no idea who have decided about ZoÃ«s kitchen food but I have tried turkey wrap which was soggy, wet with wet cheese inside and no taste on the way to LA and on the way back to Chicago I give them a 2nd chance and tried chicken sandwich which had hard ciabatta some kind of sauce that made ciabatta soggy inside.

Oklahoma City to Tampa. The absolute worst airline. Customer service leaves a lot to be desired. I was transferred 4 times. I will never fly American again. The staff in customer service for Dallas airport was very belittling to me. So he cancelled my flight because I told him to go back home.

New York to Dallas. Every time I've flown through them, my flight has been delayed. We had a 1 pm EST flight from LGA to DFW, which was cancelled eventually after several delays due to mechanical issue. Then we were put on a 7 pm flight that also got delayed several times before departing at 8:15 pm. We arrived at DFW at 11 pm, 7 hours later than we were suppose to! No, we didn't get any voucher or anything for the delay. There were other airlines that were cheaper than American Airlines but I chose AA thinking we will fly in comfort because of the extra cost. I was very wrong! I am never flying on an AA again. Please do yourself a favor and avoid them if you can. They are not worth the extra money. Infact they were a lot worse in my experience compared to other cheaper airlines. I have flown to NYC from DFW and back several times before on other airlines and not once did I experience any kind of delays. I give them 0/10.

Austin to Durango via Dallas. Well we made our flight to Dallas barely on time. Then our flight was delayed but that was ok we were going to make it, we made it to our gate on time only to find that it was closed and people on standby were put ahead of us, even though we were expected to make our flight and we bought our tickets months in advance. Thank you American legal for the worst flight experience ever. The flight attendants were polite, but they couldn't do anything for us.

St. Thomas to Detroit via Philadelphia. Honestly, this airline provided me the worst experience as far as flying goes, I fly somewhere usually once or twice a year, and I've been traveling via air travel for as long as I can remember. I opted to take AA instead of Spirit because I wanted a middle of the road airline to avoid delays or issues. Every flight and connecting flight I rode on was delayed by hours, the last trip being the longest of the delays. AA provided us â€œfree chipsâ€ instead of meal tickets as their apology for such a long delay. Unless you went to the front desk and complained to their staff, nothing else was offered or provided. I found out some customers were given extra miles or credit towards another ticket at the airport, so I decided to call AA customer service to try and get the same credit. Instead of receiving help, I was talking to an extremely rude â€œcustomer serviceâ€ agent who at the end of our phone conversation was literally screaming and yelling at me and reduced me to tears of frustration. I spoke with a supervisor who apologized for her co workers behavior, but I was still offered no other help or credit. This airline is a joke, and you are way better off saving over 150 bucks per tickets and fly spirit or some other airline before you consider this one. At least when spirit delayed my flight they offered us meal tickets and partial credit towards another ticket. I never say this about a company, but I hope AA goes under because they are truly terrible. I feel bad for the cabin staff, because they were the only ones who were kind and supportive and they work for a bad company.

Knoxville to Charlotte. I was late (my fault) I tried to check in at the kiosk but it wouldn't let me, thinking i missed my flight. I asked the lady at the counter, she nodded her head as if i had missed it, she asked for my ID and started looking for another flight, then she called someone and asked if there were on time. She then turned to me and said start running to security so of course i did as i got to security i turned and she was right behind me, she got me through security and to the gate. (with 1 minute to spare). So as if it couldn't get any better as were both out of breath and i'm thanking her for everything she's done, she turns to go back to work and then she turns back to me, and says oh yeah your going to need this, and gives me the credit card I left at the ticket counter. Know all that being said its been a uphill battle to get her the recognition she deserves so let me help you.

St Thomas to Huntsville via Charlotte. I arrived at my gate on a 2 hour lay-over. Sat there all this time. They boarded the flight to Huntsville. Right before they closed the doors the agent called my name and just said to me â€œsorry we can't get you on this flight.â€ He didn't offer any explanation. He told me to stick around and he will see. So after I waited around he said the flight is closed, and that really upset me. First of all I had a paid ticket with an assigned seat. Second of all

Hartford to Dallas. My 4 year daughter and myself were flying with our pet, and right from the rip, the customer service/baggage check in woman was super nasty. Before even looking at our pets paperwork she was telling us she couldn't fly. I gave her all the proper documentation and she still wouldn't let our dog fly. On top of that, I asked her if there if we could get a cart ride to our terminal because I am 6 months pregnant, with back issues and a 4 year old. Her response was, "We have wheel chairs." So we walked and low and behold, there is one of those golf carts sitting right in front of terminal, not being used. Fast track, our dog stayed behind and I contacted guest relations, as I was instructed to do. She issued us vouchers, for the incorrect amount, twice, just to find out they can not be used for pet travel. On top of that, the airline wants to charge us an additional $125 for our pet to fly since we won't be on the flight with her, totaling $325 instead of $200. Their responses, "Sorry for the inconvenience but we can not do anything." Needless to say, by far the worst airline customer service we have ever encountered, and we will NEVER fly American Airlines again!

Atlanta to Chicago. The flight was smooth. I will definitely be back to purchase flights again. Wish it was more leg room but the flight and snacks we're great. Thank you American airlines for my smooth trip.

Denver to St. Louis via Chicago. American Airlines is a complete joke! First they lose my email so it was nearly impossible tracking down my boarding pass. They do not care at all for making that easier on the customer. Then my flight was running behind (not delayed, just behind) so I was late for my layover and my ticket had me boarding at the wrong gate. I finally tracked down customer service and there was a huge line. People from different flights having similar problem. Customer service didn't even care. The offered me a possible discount at a nearby hotel. They should have refunded me every dime and paid for my hotel in full. I had to spend the night at the Chicago O'hare airport which is not accommodating at all. Do not fly American Airlines! I've talked to so many others and I wish I knew before hand. Stay away from American Airlines.

Los Angeles to Miami. I was refused to be refunded for the airfare of the flight which had to be canceled due to my daughter's illness. She was only 9-month old baby who was badly vomiting and at high risk to fly. As advised by the AA airline, I provided an explanation and discharge papers from the doctor. However, it did not touch anyone in American Airline's customer service because three weeks later, I received a cold statement that refund is not allowed. I'm so greatly disappointed that will never consider American Airline again and definitely discourage my relatives and friends from considering their service.

Washington to Charlotte. I had three flights, and they wouldn't give me a seat on the first one. Finally managed to get on, then the flight got seriously delayed so I missed both my layovers because of it. Don't buy from them because you're not guaranteed the seat you paid hundreds of dollars for.

Denver to Garden City via Dallas. 4 flights on American Airlines, and late 4 times. That's a 0% on-time rate. This is a terrible airline. Average time late: 1hr. Don't fly American! Any airline is better than this.

Reno to Long beach via Phoenix . We booked a flight departing Reno airport at 9.29am which was to land at LAX 11.09am (AA 6018). AA 6018 got cancelled due to weather conditions (other airlines like Southwest didn't cancel their flights) and were booked on a new route which had a layover at Phoenix. The flights were AA 546 departing Reno at 12.45pm and landing in Phoenix at 3.28pm and AA5896 departing Phoenix at 3.56pm and landing in Long Beach at 4.15pm. You can already see how tight this layover is. The first flight was late in Phoenix by just minutes but we arrived at gate A7 and were supposed to depart at gate B16, running took 10 minutes. My sister and I caught the plane before the gate closed and were checked in but the employee who checked us in held on to my ticket in her hand while she assisted other travellers, answering their questions and letting them through. The other passengers on our first flight (AA 546) who were running towards this connecting flight (AA5896) arrived at gate B16 and the employee realised there were so many other passengers who had to board and decided to close the gate. She and the subsequent managers and other AA staff insisted that it was standard procedure to close the gates 10 mins before the flight and there was no communication from the first flight to hold this connecting flight. They even called security when one of the passengers who arrived later than us (but before the gate closed) started crying. The AA staff had us booked on the next flight from Phoenix to Long Beach (AA5899) which was delayed by 1.5hrs. The flight duration between PHX and LGB is also 1.5hrs. We realised on hindsight that even if we had got on AA5896, our checked bags wouldn't have anyway. American Airlines never should have offered such a connecting flight to passengers. Half an hour layover is clearly insufficient if passengers have to change planes and if AA flights were going to land late (it happens so frequently that it should be included in the flight time). If they told passengers that the connecting flight would be held (they told the passenger who cried), then the flight should have been held. Who lies about stuff like that? The AA employee couldn't maintain order. She prioritised passengers who were behind me while holding on to my processed ticket because they were more aggressive. My sister had already been processed and was waiting for me on the inside of the gate. She saw the employee tear my processed ticket after she closed the gate (literally in my face).

Los Angeles to Washington DCA. American entices customer loyalty by allowing preferred seat selection but then changes the plane (and the seat) without notification. As a consequence I ended up on a 5.5 hour flight in standard coach. I am 6'2". This amounts to fraudulent business practices. American's customer relations response is to say no seats are guaranteed. They bank on frequent fliers like me (I have platinum status with American) selecting preferred seats and then filling their seats by switching aircraft. After 30 years and 1.3 million miles with American I am changing airlines. Their deception and poor service are intolerable. The planes themselves are often old, the seats are unusually cramped, and amenities that are now standard (accessible plugs, screens at each seat) on other airlines are often missing.

Dallas to Rapid City. I will not choose American Airlines again. We were suppose to depart at 8:40am and we still have not moved and it's 10:20am. They first told us it would be a 20 minute wait and we would be on our way. I did appreciate the flight attendants, but other than that this time delay is ridiculous.

Denver to Los Angeles. Out of all the planes at Denver Airport American Airlines fails again. They had us wait 2.5 hours on the plane while they de-ice. We are 3 houra late to LEX and no one talked to any of us about compensation or refunds. We pay a lot to fly and i expect American Airlines to get me to my destination in a reasonable time. Today they failed.

Chicago to New York JFK. Reasonably short internal domestic flight to connect to LHR via JFK. All one can say about this airline is "grin and bear it". It is truly grim beyond grim. Flying American Airlines for internal US domestic travel is done under total sufferance. They will charge you for everything, including seat selection and baggage. This is precisely what happens when the likes of American Airlines have a virtual monopoly for US air travel. The ONLY reason to fly this airline, is that their frequent flier program is probably the easiest to use compared to Delta or United. Don't look nor expect any kind of reasonable service from this airline, from check-in to baggage collection, and the in-flight experience is terrible in economy class. What a shame!

San Juan to Salt Lake City with American Airlines. The worst flying experience ever! Flights overbooked, one was delayed 4hrs so we missed our connecting flight, our luggage was put on the wrong plane. Very unprofessional and unorganized.

Von Frankfurt nach Dallas über Los Angeles. Für AA geht es nur ums Geld – kein Interesse an der Erbringung einer Qualitätsdienstleistung. Wenn Sie den günstigsten Tarif buchen, sitzen Sie garantiert nicht mit Ihrem Partner zusammen, sondern immer auf einem Sitzplatz im Mittelteil. Tatsächlich geben sie sich alle Mühe, dies zu gewährleisten: Uns wurden beide Plätze im Mittelteil zwischen einem freien Gang und einem Fensterplatz zugewiesen. Ich schaue mir den Sitzplan an und es gibt 76 freie Plätze mit 32 möglichen Sitzplatzkombinationen nebeneinander. Ich habe noch nie von einem Unternehmen gehört, das ein Produkt herausbringt und dann dafür sorgt, dass man es hasst. Wir baten darum, am Flughafen zusammenzusitzen, und man sagte uns: 100 € und dass wir die 12 $ zu Hause oder die 240 $ hätten bezahlen sollen, um einen „Upgrade“-Tarif zu erhalten. British weist Ihnen auch einen mittleren Sitzplatz zu, aber das Flughafenpersonal weist Ihnen auf Nachfrage fröhlich einen neuen Platz zu – ohne die Einstellung „Ich habe es Ihnen doch gesagt“. Das Bodenpersonal ist gut, aber das Bordpersonal hat alle Probleme. Da vermisst man Eastern Air Lines.

Orlando to Phoenix. I think this is the worst airline. Every time we fly with them there is an issue. Booked seats 3 months and advance and got split up with 4 little children! Waiting on the plane for 3 hours to exit the plane and was late for the next international flight. No one was even helpful about it. Lost luggage which took 2 weeks to be found. Constantly delayed flights. We just hope we will never need to use this airlines again .

Honolulu to Los Angeles. I attempted to check in online 18 hours prior to my flight. For whatever reason, the system processed mine but not my wife's. Since in the inbound flight we weren't seated together, I wanted to rectify this. I called AA and the first agent who answered immediately suggested it was my fault because I "didn't check a box or something". I suggested he first listen to me and run my record locator. All I wanted to do was ensure me. And my wife sat together this time. When he did, he said this is an issue with British Airways since they issued the ticket. I said that's impossible, because BA doesn't handle check in for flights on AA. I asked to speak to a supervisor, and was told to call BA or they could put me in touch with their website tech support (why?). Both the initial agent as well as the supervisor were incredibly rude and appeared to be doing whatever possible to get me off the line. I called BA. The agent, Dev, went above and beyond what could possibly be expected, and stayed with me for an hour to help. I explained what happened and he told me they're "giving you the run around" because, of course, BA doesn't handle check in for domestic AA flights. He offered to call AA for me and we were on a conference call. The supervisor he spoke to informed him that there was an issue with the passport info. He asked them to change the info and complete checkin and was told that was impossible. He said he knows for a fact it isn't, and it happens all the time. Since checkin wasn't my issue, but seating, he suggested my wife simply be given a seat next to me and she would complete checkin at the airport. The AA supervisor said that, too, was impossible. Until she's checked in, they can't assign a seat. Once again, the BA agent explained that this is impossible and he has lists of policies and regulations, not to mention previous experience. The AA supervisor hung up on him mid sentence. He apologized profusely and said he never experienced anything like this. We called again, and the agent we got this time was just as unhelpful and refused to do anything, but was at least pleasant. She suggested I pay to select my wife's seat, because next to me there is an empty one. The BA agent again asked why they can't assign it to her, it's within 24 hours of the flight. No. They won't assign it, they won't fix her checkin, but they're happy to SELL the seat. At this point in my frustration I said fine, I'll buy it. $50 additional fee if the agent takes my payment. Both me and the BA agent were at a loss for words. I ended up going online to buy the seat next to me for my wife, with Dev and the AA supervisor on hand to confirm it went through. AA succeeded in ruining my last day in Honolulu and wasting 2 hours of my time in order to squeeze even more money out of me. I would have thought that would be it, but upon arrival at Heathrow, I learned my bags didn't make the flight (2hr layover at LAX). This airline is an absolute joke, with complete disregard for passengers. Even the discount carriers treat you better. BA offered a black and white comparison between how an airline should behave and how it shouldn't. Dev was apologizing for things that weren't his fault, stayed with me until the end, whereas AA staff were aggressive and condescending, and even hung up on their British colleague. Absolutely shameful. The plane was also terrible, but west coast/Hawaii flights typically are. Shameful behavior.

Minneapolis to Dallas. Avoid American Airlines at all costs! They gave someone my seat after I boarded the plane. They then tell me a seat number that has someone in it. Then say they meant another seat. The seat they gave me had no foot area storage to put my backpack and the gate agent argued with me that there was room. He had to board the plane to prove him wrong. I hate this airline, they are garbage. Also the smallest seats and legroom of all of them.

Flew Savannah to Minneapolis via Charlotte. Our first flight was so delayed that our second flight was cancelled for us. American Airline was supposed to call us back within the hour. They never called so we went to the airport only to find out 2 other American flights were cancelled/delayed. Big mess! The agent in Savannah said hotel vouchers would be waiting for us in Charlotte. Not true, as there was a line of about 100 people waiting to get vouchers and the gate attendant said there were no rooms available in Charlotte anyway. I wouldn't fly with American ever again!

Hartford to Grand Rapids via Philadelphia. Canceled flight and because they had a flight 23.5 hours later available they wouldn't let me switch to another airline due to their 24 hour or later rule. Took me over an hour to get hold of anyone in customer service and when I spoke to a supervisor in Dallas he literally just kept quoting me their policies and wouldn't even talk to me. What kind of customer service is this airline using?!

Los Angeles to Austin. Flown with American many times and none of the flights were ever spectacular but they got the job done. Not the case this time around. I had a flight time set for 4:05pm which got delayed to 5:30pm. I understood because it was due to weather. So here's how my situation comes into play. My original flight was supposed to arrive in Austin by 9pm and my girlfriend (who lives in Austin) and I had Valentine's Day dinner plans, which we delayed due to my flight. Now as I write this it is 6:15pm and I'm sitting in the airplane as it sits at the gate still in LA and our Valentine's Day is completely shot. No explanation as to why we're not taking off, no assistance on how to get a refund, little support all together. I know American Airlines is considered a mid tier service provider but with this experience and the mediocrity of so many previous experiences this will be the last time I fly with this company until I receive an apology. It's downright rude to ignore your customers the way I've been ignored. Especially, since I was always calm and understanding and remained patient as I was passed along from one employee to the next. All I wanted was an explanation and an apology for the delay. Neither of which I received.

Chicago to Dallas Ft Worth. My flight was delayed due to smoke in the flight control room. The plane was redirected to another airport. When I landed in Dallas I called customer support to help me get on a flight. The gentleman I talked to was very nice. He told me about flights I could get on and told me he placed me on "standby." I then ran from terminal to terminal to try and get on this flight. When I got to the desk the american airlines desk told me I was not on the list for "standby." I called customer service back to ask why I was not put on "standby" he told me his computer told him I was on "standby." I then missed that flight that had open seats available because the agent did not tell me I was not on "standby." I was added as a request to be put on the flight. Which the team outside the plane could not see. The agent at the desk then looked into why I wasnt on "standby." He then found he had to remove what customer service placed on my name to allow me to be put on "standby." This then put me one name away from getting on the next flight. After not being able to make it on that flight I thought customer service should know about what happened. I talked to a service agent that dismissed everything I told her. I ask to then speak to a supervisor. She did not treat me with respect or listen to what had happened. She only wanted me to know that policy said they did everything right. She also said she didnt know they had to explain that when the agents put you on "standby" it's not actually "standby." As a customer who flights often I assumed the airline would want to know how to better improve there customer service. She did not find this as a priority. The supervisor then was rude and nothing, but negative against the customer. I hope this review can help other individuals who are stressed that their flight is missed. Do not call customer service - they do not help only tell you how you failed as a customer. I only wish to be told the information needed as a customer.

Chicago to Jackson hole. The state of WY shut the road down to Jackson hole airport due to snow fall and wind. I called to see if they could help me adjust my flight by one day and they wouldn't do anything for me. I am being told I need to purchase another ticket to get home. If the state shut the road down how do I get to the airport? The fine is $1000 if you travel the road. Thanks a lot AA! I will make sure the company I work for knows never to use AA ever again.

Phoenix to Ontario. I been waiting for hours in the airport with absolutely no communication as to why our plane is late the service is 100% horrible probably will never fly American again should've known from last time because this is like a repeat offender

Denver to Phoenix. Agents at gate A53 was very rude to customers continuously. I arrived early and was just waiting near the gate and could not believe how the agent's would speak to customers. me being one. I will not recommend American Airlines to anyone. I am a senior citizen and required a wheelchair because of medical reasons not being able to walk long distances, the person transporting me was very rough had to take pain meds after arriving to my gate. The staff need customer service training. Worst experience ever.

St. Louis to Boston via Charlotte. Im a frequent traveler and I have pretty minimal expectations when it comes to flying economy. However, Americans Airlines does not meet any standards as far as timeliness or customer service. My first flight was delayed because we did not have any flight attendants. They were leaving the airport within minutes if boarding time. The gate attendants made their frustrations pretty clear. Actually- between both crews, the employees were speaking very unprofessionally within earshot. Even worse, this delay was because the flight attendants had â€œrequiredâ€ rest from a three hour delay the night prior. They could not begin the shift and we cannot board without them. If this was known in advance, why was the flight not delayed or alternate attendants provided? The gate ladies were livid at the lack of communication by AA. I nearly missed my connection. On my second flight, there were mechanical issues. This was announced after the left the gate and we had to turn around. We were stuck in the plane. Even worse- I was in the back row next to the toilet (which was being frequently used with the delay) and the woman in front of me was sick. She was sneezing, coughing, blowing her nose. The couple next to me moved To the other side of the plane. There were 10+ Empty middle seats on the plane. I said I was afraid of getting sick and sensitive to the smell of the toilet. I asked if I could move like the couple did and the attendant said no. I paid the base rate for my ticket. Group 9 can't move around seats. Even under special circumstances.I flew with American a couple days ago as well. There was no WiFi. On another rip I was deplaned over an hour. As I mentioned, I fly often. I am going to miss work today. Thank you for making this an easy decision for me. This will be my last trip.

Orlando to Charlotte. Never flying American Airlines again. Missed my connecting flight due to delay and no other available flights out that night, so they booked me a flight out the following morning which was all fine and understandable. The problem is that they were not willing to purchase a hotel for me and this airport did not have anywhere to sleep. So now I had to pay an additional $100 for my trip plus taxi service. I paid American to get me from point A to point B and if they were unable to do so, they should have covered hotel expense same as they would if it had been a mechanical error. This Customer Service Rep at the airport also had no sense of empathy or customer service skills. Very dissatisfied and I'll be letting my job know to avoid booking with them in the future.

Boston to St. Louis. Avoid this company if possible. I purchased tickets online for business. I paid the insurance fee, an option provided BY American Airlines. Due to a snow-storm I needed to reschedule. When I tried to reschedule, I was only permitted to delay by a few days. I wanted to wait until the following week, and stick to my Mon-Fri schedule instead of arriving mid-week. They would not accommodate me this way. I could only reschedule within a limited time-frame. Any other flight at any other time would be full price. When I informed them about my insurance, I was told they don't actually have any, and I must contact the insurer directly, even though they haven't told me who that insurer is. All I could do was cancel the flight. Even though I opted for the insurance, certain flights are non-refundable (mine) so they should not have allowed the system to offer me insurance. Now that the flight is cancelled, even though the took my money, I didn't even get any mileage credits, and they will no longer provide me with a receipt so I can be reimbursed by my employer. This company has built-in anti-consumer policies, are dishonest, and likely to scam you through what they consider standard practices. All airlines in America overcharge, use hidden fees, and continually diminish the quality of their service while raising prices. It's hard to stand out as the worst in a world of terrible, but AA has absolutely done so.

Charlotte to Buffalo. My flight was supposed to be from 10:10pm-11:45pm. It is currently 12:08am and we are still sitting on the plane. No one is talking to us. We don't know why we aren't moving. This is insane! We all just want to get to our destination. We are all cranky and hungry on this flight. No one is happy.

Minneapolis to Miami. Just can't thank you enough for the help we received after missing our connecting flight. American Airlines put us up in a hotel, gave us food vouchers and a shuttle to the hotel. It was nice to relax before catching our next flight to our destination.

New York to Dallas Ft Worth. This is the worst airline I've flown and I will never taken American Airlines again. I accidentally purchased a ticket to leave March 10th and I had to leave Feb 10th. I was at the airport when I found out. When I went to speak to the front desk no one was helpful. They said I couldn't cancel my ticket and also lied and said I could change my flight. Finally after talking to 4 people I spoke with an agent who said I could use the funds towards a flight to leave today. The cost was suppose to be $373. after processing my credit card 6 times he tells me he didnt know how much I was charged. Come to find out i was charged $775 dollars plus a processing fee. They are horrible. Worst airport experience.

Fort Walton Beach to Pittsburgh. This was the worst experience flying I have ever had. They delayed my flight on 2/9/19 due to maintenance and I missed my connecting flight. Where I was supposed to fly Charlotte to Pittsburgh with a 1 hr layover. Any other later connecting flights were already overbooked. I had to miss work the following day and leave the next day 2/10/19. We left from ECP airport at 541 am and now had a 4 hr layover in Charlotte. They then delayed my connecting flight to Pittsburgh due to maintenance again where we are now currently waiting on a 5 hr layover and counting. There customer service department sucks just as bad as there flights do!

Columbus to Washington. Worst experience ever with an airline. My flight arrived early, at 7:50am didn't get to the terminal until 8:25am, because planes were blocking our terminal. My next flight was to depart at 8:30am, arrived at the fat at 8:27am and my flight had already left. I'm stuck in an airport all day, until 6pm. I should have been in Key West by 11:30am. They refuse to compensate my time and the inconvenience. Not worth the money, fly Southwest or United.

San Jose to Phoenix. Looks like American Airlines are finally improving their customer service. FA's and gate agents on all of my 4 legs were way friendlier than those of my past experience a couple of years ago. They interact more with their pax and even smile. The new leather seat design looks nice and modern. On the 5 hours leg PHX-SJO you get a sandwich and They come around twice with drinks and non alcoholic beverages are for free. The captain or co comes out of the cockpit and greets the pax when they deplane. That's a very nice touch. They offer a good selection of movies and TV series for free, but you have to stream those via your phone or laptop since they got rid of the IFEs. That I do understand, but then they should at least offer power ports for your devices. Otherwise you may run out of battery mid flight.

Orlando to Fort Wayne. Worst airline ever, our flight was delayed for no purpose other than to move another flight ahead. On top of that we got to our connector flight. However, when we got there the desk attendant had the audacity to say "aww if only you were here 30 seconds ago, because we just stopped accepting changes." But the flight was 10 minutes from boarding.

Bruxelles à Tampa via Londres / Philadelphie. Au cours des 3 derniers jours, j'ai appelé la ligne Advantage d'AA pour discuter du fait qu'il y aura une grève nationale en Belgique le 13 février (date du vol de retour) et que j'aimerais savoir si je peux changer ou renoncer à la première étape du vol de Bruxelles à Londres. La nouvelle de la grève a été rapportée par plusieurs médias internationaux depuis la semaine dernière, et la grève devrait fermer tout le pays, y compris l'aéroport de Bruxelles. Cependant, American dit qu'ils n'ont reçu aucun avis du siège et ne peuvent donc pas modifier ma réservation sans appliquer de frais. Après avoir reçu la même réponse 3 fois, j'ai demandé si je pouvais obtenir le numéro du siège, mais lorsque j'ai appelé et parcouru les 15 invites environ du service client, j'ai reçu un message automatisé indiquant qu'ils étaient fermés et que je devrais appeler de retour pendant les heures normales de bureau (il était 11h un mardi, remarquez). Maintenant, je comprends que les procédures sont là pour une raison et que la compagnie aérienne fait un joli sou sur les changements de billets, mais dans des cas comme celui-ci où il est clair qu'aucun vol ne décollera de Bru le 13 février, pourquoi est-ce que j'ai demander à AA d'examiner le problème et d'être proactif pour modifier ma réservation ? Je dois être de retour aux États-Unis le 13, mais ce que je crains, c'est que je reçoive un message le 12 m'indiquant que le vol a été annulé et que je reçois une nouvelle réservation pour le 14, le 15 ou même plus tard. Dans l'ensemble, je suis frustré par l'expérience AA Advantage et les représentants et les superviseurs me disent qu'ils ont les mains liées jusqu'à ce que le siège social leur donne le feu vert. Je suis également frustré de constater que malgré le fait d'être un client fidèle au cours des dernières années, j'ai l'impression que les AA me donnent du fil à retordre et que je me fiche de mon inquiétude concernant mon retour le 13. Très décevant.

New York JFK to Boston. I counted 72 vacant window and aisle seats vacant on this flight yet their system assigns me a middle seat between a vacant aisle and window? All so they can get an extra $9 from me? I think that is craven and base. United is the worst US airline but they don't do that to their customers. Neither does DL, B6, or AS, so I will patronise them in the future. There is more to life than getting the last penny out of a person's pocket. Have asked my travel agent to void the ticket and have rebooked Jet Blue, who allows you to pre-assign seats at no cost.

Philadelphia to Miami. Horrible flight. Once my group was called they ran out of carry on space and had to put my very tiny suitcase with the luggage forcing me to go through baggage claim on both of my flights! Then once on the plane they detected a problem with the plane that took an hour to fix

Las Vegas to Chicago via Milwaukee. Our airline was late due to a flight attendant being late to board the plane, the flight was delayed a total of 3 times putting us approx. 45 minutes behind. We did make up some significant time on our duration and got off the plane with about 20 minutes to spare, we ran across the airport to our gate where we learned that they gave our seats away due to us. It being there, the funny thing was they also informed us that they oversold our flight and gave our seats to those people. The best the guy at the counter could offer us was a flight almost 4 hours later or a $20 bus ticket- unbelievable, one of the most unaccomadating experiences I have been related to. Come on American get your act together.

Chicago to Detroit. anged departure times 3 times due to delayed flight, changed gate, changed plane and my seat. Seat was the most uncomfortable I've ever sat in. Sat on runway waiting to arrive. Will avoid American Airlines like the plague from now on.

Paris CDG à Chicago O'Hare avec American Airlines. Ce vol était fantastique. Un vol de 9 heures a été rendu extrêmement confortable certainement à cause du nouvel avion mais et de l'équipage en vol. L'équipage était très sympathique et a tout géré de manière professionnelle. L'avion était aussi incroyable. C'était un tout nouveau Boeing 787 avec un divertissement en vol incroyable, un décollage/atterrissage super doux et une cabine extrêmement silencieuse, moderne et propre. Nous avons également été autorisés à nous déplacer car le vol n'était pas plein.

Minneapolis to Charlotte. Usual poor customer service we have all come to expect from airline companies. Flight delays, overbooked flight, and no room for overhead baggage. App wouldn't load tickets at time of flight (website also encountering errors). On site customer service reps were extremely slow.

Los Angeles to Sacramento. American Airlines is the nastiest between the US airlines! Next time will fly with Alaska! It was last flight and canceled it and there was another fight get issues like my flight too. The seats are too small although im not a big guy. There was plenty of empty seats from my flight from SMF-LAX but they put us three people in three small seats! not sure why no flight attendants even ask us are you comfy? d

Miami to Paris. I would like to say thank you to Godfrey a supervisor in the reservation service department for assisting me with my reservation after having the worst experience with a representative on the phone. After having doubts why I became an Aviator Advantage member when I spoke with Godfrey he made all my traveling plans at ease, Thank you once again.

London to Miami. On Saturday flew AA39 and had the most uncomfortable flight ever, have been flying with American Airlines for over 25 years and clocked over 1 million miles. Legroom has been reduced and the seats slope down so arrived in Miami with a back ache. The crew were dong their best but must be demoralized by have to work with such a poor product. Will have to endure the return trip but probably the last time I fly with AA.

Chicago to Vancouver. Incredibly bad service. The cabin was cold. Flight attendant made no effort to address this when requested. Flight attendant disappeared to the back of the plane. Never came by after the first 1/2 hour to see if there were any client needs. Flight attendant looked disheveled. Torn stockings. Chewing gum. When she finally showed up at the end of the flight and took her seat, she sat down, chewing her gum, focused on her cell phone. No hello or goodbye on entry/exit. Suggestion, in these times of competition for customer dollars, a little bit of 4-seasons training for this employee would be a great idea. As an employer, I would have instantly terminated her.

Oklahoma City to Los Angeles. We showed up at 0440 for our 0610 flight only to make it to baggage check in to be told that because we checked our bags at 0516 that we were too late to check in because we were having to wait in line because they didn't have enough attendants to help everyone. They told us to stand to the side waiting even longer I helped just to find out had they did their job we should have boarded. My first and last time flying American Airlines never again. They just rebooked us on a full flight telling us maybe we would get on.

Detroit to Chicago. I find it incredibly unaccomodating that I was told I could not be given a seat next to my husband even if there was one available, because they were not to accommodate someone with basic economy.

Von Frankfurt nach New York. Das war ein toller Flug. Ich bin von/nach Frankfurt und New York gereist. Ihre Großzügigkeit beim Essen war für einen so langen Flug großartig. Wir tranken etwas, dann einen Snack, dann Mittagessen, dann noch einen Snack und tranken ein letztes Mal. Die Sitze waren sehr bequem und die Unterhaltung hielt mich während des gesamten Fluges wach. LOL, das ist normalerweise schwierig, weil ich es nicht mag, irgendetwas anzuschauen! Aber es gab neue Filme und es hat mir im Großen und Ganzen gefallen! Nicht zu vergessen: Die Landungen waren perfekt!

Honolulu to Dallas. The flight listed I didn't even make because this airline chose to overbook and make early online check in impossible for my class, the site quite literally read "we currently don't have enough seats to assign one to you now, please check in upon arrival at airport for seat assignment". I was using transportation provided by the airport so had no control over my arrival time, I did arrival an hour early and got denied a place so my flight got bumped. Didn't read anywhere that seats were first come first serve, would've booked Delta had I known. I've currently been stuck in the airport 8 hours and will be arriving 6 after my expected arrival time, absolutely outrageous. The American Airlines employee response to my "inconvenience" was "well, this change won't be charged, and at least you'll make it home"....Are you kidding?! I didn't book the flight I got stuck on purely for the inconvenience to me, and round trip means you get to go home. She had the audacity to claim it could be worse and they could make me pay for their lack organization and counting skills, it's not that difficult American Airlines, simply count the seats on your airplane and stop selling tickets when you hit that number, account for the pilot and any staff needed on board, believe it or not it's that simple. They did provide a $12 food voucher at the airport that was only brought to my attention by another passenger who got bumped, not even an airline employee, nice gesture but doesn't make up for the 14 hours of my life I won't get back. Yes American Airlines that's math you've obviously not seen it before. Ridiculous.

Portland to Los Angeles. Traveling for a family emergency, so I booked last minute and my best option was to travel via American Airlines. My flight out of Portland was delayed, as is my connecting flight (1.5 hrs so far). The aircraft I traveled in was extremely dirty, making my experience much more unpleasant. Customer service does not seem to care. Will never travel American Airlines ever again. The level of customer service is not up to par with other airlines like Delta and Alaska.

Cancun to St. Louis via Chicago. There was air traffic/ground traffic causing me to miss my connecting flight which I had a 2.5 hour window to make. I was told that the airline does not supply hotel vouchers or even meal vouchers because the plane landed on time there was just traffic on the ground so we couldn't get off the plane. Nothing was done besides handing me a slip of paper to sleep in the airport or pay for an hotel when clearly it was out of my control. The customer service reps were entirely to rude. No to mention my flight was delayed according to my text alert but they closed the doors 15 mins early so I still could not board. I have no idea where my luggage is. The customer service reps were rude, and could care less about helping me find a comfortable place, I sucked up the fact that I was staying in the airport overnight after travels literally all day and asked for directions to the military USO. A place I knew I could sleep comfortably, the custome assistance rep responded â€œI don't know it's somewhere in hereâ€ and proceeded to talk to her co worker. I was told multiple times that's it was not the airlines fault that I missed the connecting flight and policy is not the accommodate me. Which is ridiculous! I did not fly the plane I did not cause the traffic jam, how is the airline not at fault? I was not pointing the finger, but at 2300hrs after traveling for over 13 hours I just wanted to lay down or even someone to speak to who respected me as a person instead of a burden on their job. The next morning after sleeping in the USO I eventually located I headed to my gate which was printed on the ticket. Only 30 mins before boarding I realized the screen had not changed to my final destination. After checking the main listing of of flights and gates screen, I found my gate had changed without notification whatsoever, and it was on the complete opposite side of the airport. The whole airline experience was horrible! I will never fly this airline again, not even if it were $1 per flight. The customer service needs a serious retrain on quality customer care! 0 out of 10

Amsterdam naar Philadelphia. American Airlines is verschrikkelijk. We hoorden dat er tijdens onze negen uur durende vlucht alleen overheadschermen zouden zijn, ik heb de AA-app gedownload die gratis films voor tijdens de vlucht zou hebben. De binnenkant van het vliegtuig zag er als nieuw uit in de businesscabine, maar was in 1990-stijl in de economycabine. Toen de vlucht vertrok, hoorde ik dat de app niet zou werken. De begeleider zei dat ik een boek mocht lezen. Kort daarna gingen alle lichten uit (geen nachtvlucht) en kon ik niet lezen. Vreselijke luchtvaartmaatschappij!

Oakland to Montego Bay via Phoenix / Charlotte. I recently traveled on American Airlines on several flights over a period of a few days. After booking, I read lots of bad reviews about AA. My experience with AA was great! All six flights were on time. The staff at the gate and on the plane were friendly and helpful. The pilot kept us informed when we were about to experience turbulence. Overall a great experience!

Albany to Columbus via Philadelphia. This is by far the worst experience that I have ever had with an airline. I had a flight delay leaving my original location from a business trip due to air traffic. After arriving in Philadelphia, I had less than 5 minutes to run from terminal F to terminal B to reach my connecting flight. I gave it my best effort to make it, but sadly missed the flight by only a minute or so. I approached customer service who told me the the next flight to my location was the following morning. I informed them that I was flexible on airport locations, and that I would be willing to fly into any airport in Ohio. They were quite rude in informing me that I had no time to make the next flight to Cleveland, so I had no choice but to wait. I asked about hotel accommodations, to which they said that they only offered a discounted rate, however, if I would like to sleep in the airport, there were cots. I called about the rates and found nothing cheaper than $100 + tax. I decided to sleep in the airport, however I was informed later that there were no cots, and the airport had stopped providing them some time ago. After asking around, my only option was a small pillow and blanket and to find a "comfy" spot in the airport. Overall, I found American Airlines to be extremely unprofessional and unwilling to accommodate, despite the fact this was no fault of my own, but rather a fault of the airline. I will not be flying with American Airlines again and do not recommend them.

Dallas to Saint Louis. The worst airline ever. Very rude people. I sat in airport 14 hours. Got shuffled from plane to plane which both was broken missed 2 flights. Cause of the plane issues was never once told sorry. Was very confused on what was going on. Never again will I fly with them.

Missoula to Indianapolis via Dallas (Abilene). Horrible, delay, added City layover, added day to US only flight, 2 gate changes. Complaints - no food available due to rerouting to non 24 hour airport, airplane toilet not working part of one flight, airplane toilet not working entire portion of one flight. No Water on one flight - very, very, very long tarmac delay. Delay almost 2 hours in Missoula with 11 passenger reduction to take on addition fuel additional flight time to be rerouted to non 24 hour airport

New York JFK to Madrid. Worst customer service ever. Hiring rude employees who are not at all accommodating or helpful is the exact opposite service you advertise. The woman at check in was rude from the beginning of the conversation to the very end when she was explaining what is an allotted check in bag and what is not. How do you expect to keep up with competing airlines when the forefront of your company sets such an awful tone?

Philadelphia to San Juan. American delayed our flight due to â€œmaintenance issuesâ€ 20 minutes before we were supposed to board. That delay caused us to miss our connecting flight in San Juan. We had to pay $340 with another carrier to change our missed flight. American refuses to reimburse our money. They said they can't â€œguarantee arrival timesâ€œ. I will never fly them again. Terrible customer service. To me they should be responsible when the flight is delayed for mechanical maintenance issues!

Ciudad de México a Jacksonville vía Dallas. La peor experiencia que he tenido. Primero me hacen comprar otro boleto para mí y otros dos miembros de la familia, luego retrasan mi vuelo desde DFW por más de dos horas porque el avión no funcionaba correctamente. Gracias a esto me perdí una reunión importante en el trabajo.

Richmond to Charlotte. Original flight through PHL was cancelled due to mechanical problems but alternative arrangements were just fine. It's when things go wrong that airline service is truly revealed. I was very pleased with my rebooking and the service I received. I found the American Airlines app helpful. American Airlines made a great vacation possible and I am looking forward to doing it again. Nothing to complain about!

Miami to New York. Worst experience flying ever. I took this airline to get from Montreal to Lima and back, and on the way one flight was delayed 17h because of mechanical issues before finally getting cancelled which made us miss our 2 connecting flights. The first connection was replaced because it was the same airline, but they didn't care at all when we called them about the last flight which was booked with LATAM Peru. On the way back security ran very long cuz of government shut down so we only got to our plane 1 minute before the doors closed and we were told that we couldn't get on and that our seats had been given to someone else. On the way our trip took 48h instead of 16h (and we had to pay for another ticket which later lead to more complications) and on the way back we are currently on stand by but doesn't seem like we are getting on a flight any time soon. I have never dealt with customer service people that cared less about your situation and had such little empathy especially after Everything they made us go through on the way to Lima and now on the way back as well. Terrible airline, terrible service 0% recommend!

Norfolk to Honolulu via Dallas Ft Worth. Best Flight Attendants I've ever had, they took time for questions they were beyond kind and made sure accommodations were comfortable, they were courteous professionals. Prices are great, Entertainment, and staff is just amazing. I can say that from here on out I'll continue to be a loyal AA customer and I hope this review reaches the staff attending flight A5 from DFW to HNL and AA1998.

Atlanta to Boston via Charlotte. Absolutely nothing wrong with the in-flight product on this domestic connecting flight. It was an older plane, so seat pitch and recline were reasonable. I suspect the newer layout would be less comfortable. Staff were friendly. Unfortunately they wanted $75pp to be put on the standby list for the sooner connecting flight, which seemed unreasonable as it would only save us 1 hour. Their hold times for phone service were ridiculous (45min+).

New York JFK to Buenos Aires. Very fast check in at terminal 8. Business class lounge ample with good selection of food and drink. First on board. Was offered champagne in a plastic cup followed by newspapers, etc. 10pm flight, not full, departed the gate 30 minutes ahead of schedule. Business class seats comfortable although I do not like the backward facing one I got - not shown on the seat map when I booked - beware. Dinner was rushed through, not very appetizing, but wines good. Got the impression, as usual, that the crew wanted to get on with their rest and ignore the passengers/ customers. Breakfast option of Chili Omelette was weird, to say the least, and not appropriate for most passengers, plus served less than 45 minutes before landing and therefore extremely hurried. No chance of a second cup of coffee. Fruit plate was barely acceptable as most of the fruit was not ripe. In sum, have been on more pleasant transatlantic AA flights with better much service and much better food. Seemed like a different airline. IFE was OK, no current movies, but live TV goo

Savannah to Miami. Flight delayed repeatedly, for more than five hours, how is it possible to make any connections. Extra fees for everything, checked bags, drinks, snacks, headphones. How does this airline compete on the global market.

Guadalajara to Dallas Ft Worth. Flying AA in economy (Booked using BA Avios) you must purchase your checked in luggage at the check in. This caused insane mess and it took ages. Check in agent then informed us that we are not seating together and offered to seat us together at the cost. This is a blatant extortion! Besides, this is completely unsafe practice, as in case of an accident split families will look for one another putting the whole evacuation at the jeopardy, but i guess for AA it's only $$$ that matter. Safety is overrated. Staff ground as well as flight crew, not a friendly bone in their body. Service is fast and efficient though, but might as well be performed by robots.

Los Angeles to London. Another deeply disappointing experience with American, and this time it involves an illegal, deceptive sales method. Purchased a so-called "basic economy" ticket from LAX to Bucharest at a not so basic price. This allows me to check in 24-hours in advance and obtain the best seats then available. Was unable to check-in online and was told it is because I am flying on BA to Romania. Romania is a EC member-country just like France, England, & Germany and also does not require a visa of US-citizens, so I do not understand this pretext. I was told to drive out to LAX and check-in tomorrow when there is nothing left but middle seats in the back. I protested and then learnt the real reason my check-in is restricted: they advised me to purchase seat assignments online for more than $100. When I protested further the agent told me it was my own fault for buying "basic economy," but I responded that the real error here is patronising American Airlines. This is what is called by the FTC "bait-and-switch" and it is illegal. I am dreading this trip now because of this and the 3-hour connexion on BA - the last time I flew AA to London and then a BA flight to DÃ¼sseldorf my suitcase was delayed for two hours but it took BA five days to bring it to me and by that time I was on my way back to the airport to continue my journey - they then tried to negotiate me down on my modest interim expenses. I advise you to save yourself anguish, headaches, and "American-"style service (that means discourtesy all around and bitter stewardesses with chips on their shoulders) and fly a foreign carrier like KLM, Swissair, Lufthansa, or Austrian. You'll arrive happier and in good condition.

Montego Bay to Denver via Dallas. Worst customer service of any airline I have ever flown! Stark curtness and pure rudeness from the ticketing staff to the attendants. Must be a bad company to work for because every single staff member, on all legs of our trip, behaved like it was the worst day of their life. We felt as if we were inconveniencing everyone just by existing. This in turn, made this the most uncomfortable and unenjoyable journey of my life. We will continue to patronize our current favorite airline, Southwest, and avoid American Airlines at all costs! We will also be preaching to anyone who will listen about how horrible our experience was.

Portland to Phoenix. Disappointed with policies. Paid to upgrade to premium class, sat next to a big guy who was stuck in middle seat. All exit seats were open, asked to move back to the exit seat so we were all a bit more comfortable, but nope "against the policies". Won't fly this airline again if there are choices, clearly a corporate decision to take customer service and reasonable accommodation out of the employees hands. Disappointed with how far this airline has fallen!

Seattle to Wilkes-Barre via Chicago. If you are able to, I would avoid American Airlines if it is possible for you to. First, the flight was delayed because their defroster wasn't working, which could have been avoided by them warming it while we were boarding, rather than waiting till we had been sitting for awhile to defrost it! So we sat there for about twenty minutes until they finally got their defroster out and then we had to wait another hour for them to fix the defroster. Because of this, I missed my connecting flight in Chicago. The only positive thing about American Airlines is that they re-booked my flight automatically after the delay. But the next flight wasn't for another seven hours! Then, once I boarded the next flight, we sat for an hour again because there was "traffic" from the other airplanes. American Airlines was just a mess as you can see. Not to mention, completely unprofessional. While on the first flight (flying to Chicago), I saw the flight attendant on his phone while he was supposed to be handing out refreshments to people and they were very lazy. Two of the three flight attendants sat for most of the flight. The woman who was in charge of boarding was very rude, and I ended up having to check my second carry-on bag because they are very strict about the dimensions. My bag barely was over the dimensions. Overall, it was a very bad experience and such an unprofessional environment, filled with many incompetent people.

Detroit to Dallas. Horrible experience. I had to jump through many hoops in order to pay for my bag, and the agent helping me with it took so long that I almost missed my flight. When rushing to security I accidentally left my backpack at the counter and when I came back minutes later it was gone and the agent at the counter was extremely rude and unhelpful when I asked her if she had seen my backpack. At my gate I was practically yelled at by customer service for asking if they knew where my bag was. I also tried to call the airline to speak to someone in customer service to see if they had my backpack and was left ringing for 10 minutes before I finally hung up. Wish I could give them negative stars.

Amsterdam naar Philadelphia. Op weg naar Philadelphia: - entertainmentsysteem ouderwetse monitoren - geen van de handsets werkte, dus we konden niet naar de vertoonde films luisteren - voedsel dat werd uitgedeeld was van ondermaatse kwaliteit - beenruimte voor mijn lengte 1 meter 90 een ramp in de stoelen aan het gangpad op de vloer zijn er dozen voor het niet werkende communicatiesysteem die 25% van de ruimte innemen om je benen te plaatsen. De weg terug met nog oudere 767-300 - het entertainmentsysteem werkte helemaal niet - we sloegen de maaltijd over - we probeerden het "continentale ontbijt", wat gewoon een complete grap is, hoe kun je yoghurt verpesten? - stoelen zijn ongemakkelijk en oud.

Lafayette to Portland via Dallas. Absolutely terrible, poorly organized staff and files, will lie on reports to ensure you cannot get compensation for issues they caused. My first flight was delayed by over an hour due to another plane making an emergency landing on my flights runway, and they wrote it down as 'weather delay' because they knew if they did I would not get compensation for a hotel when I inevitably missed my connecting flight. They also constantly demand you check your carry on because they don't allocate enough space for them on flight. Overall the worst flying experience I have had to date, I would steer clear of them if you value your time and money.

New York to Nasville. I was not notified until just a few hours before my flight that they had too much weight on the flight. So instead of notifying me earlier, it was more so last minute. Then, they let us go down the terminal ramp to the plane, and another American airlines employee rudeley told us to go back up the ramp. The employees were very slow at rebooking and we even saw them send another couple to baggage claim to get their bags instead of checking the gate they were at, (which the bags were actually at that gate). Very disorganized airline. This will be the absolute last time flying with them ever again.

Reno to Phoenix via Yuma. I paid over 1,100.00 for 2 round trip tickets for my son and I to visit my husband living in Reno for work. The dates were Dec 26th - Jan 2. I was bumped off both directions to a later flight. Luckily, I purchased flight insurance for this possibility. I still paid even more to check 2 bags each way. That is a ridiculous amount to pay and get bumped off both flights. I arrived this morning at Reno/Tahoe at 5 Am for a flight after 6 Am and there was nobody at the counter to check me in. That's not acceptable. Specially paying over $1,100.00. I could have bought a used car and drove home for that much money.

Albuquerque to Rochester via Chicago. Our initial flight home was booked for 1/1/19 on AA1431 at 6:54am. American Airline canceled our flight on 1/1 gave us a rebook on 1/2. Then once again canceled our flight 1/2 as well. These cancellations provided us with hardship. No place to stay. No reimbursement or food voucher or free tickets. They canceled us twice and we are stranded fending for our selves. They did not even give us option to fly sooner than. 48 hours is way too long to be stuck somewhere unplanned with children in tow!

Cancun to Dallas Ft Worth. Due to bad weather in the US, our return flight from Mexico to DFW was cancelled - this is not what I'm upset about. My concern is how we were treated. There was NO airline rep at the gate, and we were told over the PA to go to another gate for "more info", which they never communicated what was going on or how we would book another flight. We had to go back through customs and they transported all passengers to different resorts for the night (I do appreciate the accommodation), but still, no information on how to secure new flights. Not everyone had international phone service if they even had a personal phone, and, the resort didn't have a way to get online and book a new flight. The app said "no flights available", and if you tried calling AA, you would get hung up on. After 1.5 hours on hold, we were able to secure a flight. AA should have re-booked everyone before we were transported away from the airport. I was traveling with a group of 10, including 2 in a wheelchair. Once we made it to DFW, our flight to Kansas City was "oversold", even though we had tickets and the agent at the gate was very rude and not empathetic, nor did she communicate what was going on. I was told "you should thank this man for giving up his seat for you" - really? This is not how you treat customers. I submitted a compliant, and they said they were "sorry for the weather, outside of their control", and I responded that is not what I was complaining about, and they sent another response back saying "it's not their policy to compensate"...again, that is not what I was looking for. I just wanted to provide feedback so they have an opportunity to not lose any more customers. I will never fly with American Airlines again. I should have stuck with my old faithful and reliable Southwest Airlines

London to Montreal via Chicago. American Airlines do not respect schedule, they made me miss my flight to Montreal through Chicago, no support no nothing on new years eve. I will never travel this airline again.

Dallas to New York JFK. After working nonstop to be able to fly for New Years to see my family and friends. I was meeting a friend in NY for a day and a half to spend there. American Airlines decides to canceled my flight less than 12 hours before. Their explanations was because the plane of my flight was canceled at his first destination. They scheduled me for 2 days after and I changed it for the next day. I missed my day in NY, the whole reason I did this trip. Never getting a flight with American Airlines.

Kona to Washington via Los Angeles. I really enjoyed my flight with American Airlines, everything that could go right did go right. My plane left on time for both flights and the staff seemed to go out of their way to make sure everyone had a great flight. They frequently made rounds throughout the cabin but could tell if you did not want to be bothered. My seat was pretty comfortable and I had enough space to be comfortable. I was surprised how comfort the seat was since I am 6 feet tall and usually find economy seats to be very cramped. The only problem I had with my seat was, the USB port on the A321 did not work.

New York to Kingston via Miami. Horrible customer service. Want computers to do their job for them. 4 hour delay for maintenance. Slept in Miami airport overnight for them to tell me I have to pay $150 for my carry on bag after it was already carried on to my first flight. All about money. No respect from either rep at airport or supervisor. Demanding more money. Had to throw out my brand new carry on bag. Called 1-800 rep she said for me to keep receipts for refunds because supervisor at airport is incorrect. Most frustrating service ever and I fly often.

Boise to Phoenix. Let's put a screen in the back of every seat. And, just as passengers begin to fall asleep let's pump loud, obnoxious ads into their faces preventing from sleeping because we won't let them be allowed to control the screen or volume and be forced to continue to listen to our ads for credit, food and movies over and over. And don't forget the bag of broken up stale pretzels. I'll never fly American again.

Charlotte to Tulsa. American Airlines is the worst airline to fly with. Everytime there is a 1-5 hour layover. They overbook the flights and have 0 customer service. I will be choosing a different airline in the future because this airline is never going to get me to my final destination on time!

Knoxville to Charlotte. I missed my flight due to the slow understaffed check-In and TSA. I got to the airport more more than an hour in advance and was forced to stand for an entire hour. The TSA line was unreal and none of the staff was kind. Along with my self 9 others missed this flight. The staff was so rude and they closed the door in our face.

Las Vegas to Dallas via Columbia. I don't know where to begin because I had so many problems with American Airlines. Flight from Las Vegas to Dallas canceled. Was given alternate flight to Chicago - Charlotte - Columbia. Landed in Chicago only to be told flight to Charlotte had also been canceled. I went to AA Customer Relations and spoke to extremely rude agent. No flights out of Chicago so ended up spending the night in the airport. AA provided "hotel discount coupon" which was useless since hotels were already booked. No food voucher provided. I did not have a carry on bag due to AA's policy for economy travelers, I asked that my checked bag be brought to me so I could get my medication. My checked bag was located in Philadelphia even though I had no connections in Philadelphia. The next day, my flight to Columbia, SC was diverted to Charleston. Finally made it to Columbia after 28.5 hours only to find that my checked bag had made it to Columbia hours earlier. So AA can get your checked luggage to destination sooner than passengers. Makes absolutely no sense.

Seattle to Aruba via Philadelphia. I was at the airport early. I checked in with no one in front of me. My luggage was checked in right away with no issues. So when I arrived in Aruba, there was no luggage. I was told it was still in Philly and it would be sent to Miami and then onto Aruba. Well the next day it was till in Philly and it was going to be sent from Philly. I finally received it about 7:00pm . Really disappointed in AA.

Dallas to San Diego. The day after Christmas, there was a storm in Dallas so our plane was delayed. The problem was that when finally boarded for the third time and got to the runway, it was announced that it was cancelled so that another group of travelers could board our plane and go to LA along with our luggage, which they said they couldn't take off the plane. We were left in the terminal, without luggage for three days. Who does this!

Philadelphia to San Diego. Very disappointed! My flight was from Philadelphia to San Diego on Thursday December 20th, gate A2. We were a group of five, my mother (a senior), me and my 2 children ( age 6 and 4) and my youngest sister. Unfortunately our seats were randomly assigned and not close to each other, so I decided to speak to the agents at the gate to help me sit at least with my kids together. I approached the guy at the gate in a very nice way and I asked him if he can help me with seats. I was shocked because of his unprofessional attitude! Instead of answering my request, he pointed at me with his fingers and asked to go ahead and board to the airplane! I repeated my question again and he started yelling at me. I boarded with my kids and family, me and my 6 years old had to sit by ourselves in different places, I asked the flight attendant if they had any open seats, she said yes, we have 20 open seats so I managed to sit at least with my son! I don't usually post bad reviews unless it's really bad! I was shocked by his attitude and poor behavior. American Airlines are losing hundreds of customers due to bad customer services. They really need to work on training their staff on how to do their job in a professional way. This person could've been able to help me but instead, he decided to act like this with a customer. Last time with AA for sure! I don't recommend them, instead, Jet blue are much better and more professional.

Chicago to Knoxville. I am appalled at the service American Airlines offered. They canceled my flight from Chicago to Knoxville at the last minute. We were literally about to board, 20 minutes later than they originally told us. After the cancellation, they offered us zero help. They said our flight could not be rebooked and that we would have to leave Mmuch later than expected. They also refused to pay for a room for us to stay in, even though it was their fault. There were also little to no seats on the flights we needed

Austin to Phoenix. My original flight was for Friday around 6 am on December 28th. The customer service swore there were no other flights to get me out on that same day so they got me on a flight for the 29th. Already one day taken away from my trip I was made but was willing to work with it. They have now delayed my flight on the 29th by 5 hours and are hesitant to work with me in getting onto a quicker flight to get me out of here.
