I have spoken to many people and no one has been helpful. I will never fly this airline again and will stick to Southwest Airlines which is always faithful and I have never had any issues with.

Dallas to Atlanta. Horrible experience. Delays after delays and on top of that a bunch of attitude. Made us check our small bag in when ones clearly larger than ours was put overhead. Never again. Thanks American for reassuring me that Delta is the way to travel. Never had delays or snobby employees with Delta.

Knoxville to Dallas. Will never be flying with American again. This was my first experience with them. Flight was cancelled due to weather and then due to their mistakes I was not able to board the flight that I rescheduled for. For the third time that I rescheduled they scheduled me for the wrong time. Now I am having to reschedule my flight but no agents are getting back to me. 0/10 terrible service. Unprofessional and incompetent staff. Poor experience.

Memphis to Denver. The day after Christmas, when all i wanted to do was go back to Denver, when a startling email, caught me asunder. My flight had been canceled due to lack of a reason, I should have known not to fly American this season. I rebooked my flight for the morning of tomorrow only to find I was again stranded, cancelled. There's nothing we can do the lady told me, no customer service to my disbelief. I said give me a refund, they said no way. I said fine, I'm flying southwest. Have a good day.

Denver to Miami. I am glad I am home and the flight was safe. However the customer service of American Airlines is so bad, nobody really cares about you, as a matter of fact it's quite the opposite. After canceling our flight at 1 am for reasons not valid since they said it was due to weather but the gate across the hall from us departed to Miami half an hour after and our plane was sitting there the entire time, nobody cared to give us assistance with hotel, and in order to book another flight home which happened to be on my birthday, we had to wait 4 and a half hours on hold, and were able to get on a flight for 2 days later. The worst part is that once we arrive at the ticket counter after all we went through they make a big deal about 4 pounds over weight of my luggage and we purchased the main cabin seats so we can be more comfortable and guess what? Seats don't recline! We pay $50 for seats that don't recline! I was exhausted and for a 1:20 am flight you want to sleep, you figure they will tell you seats don't recline!

Chicago to Newark. Our flight was delayed from Cancun to Newark and American Airlines put us on a flight from Chicago to JFK . I was just curious to know if there were any other flights closest to our destination since I saw one available to Newark, but the people at the kiosk were extremely rude and annoying. I sincerely request American Airlines to please incorporate courtesy training with the staff at American Airlines.Its really annoying and insulting for people who wait for 28 hours for the flight and then have to face such annnoying comments. I don't mind to some extent to wait for the flights due to whatever delays but I at least expect the customer service to be decent enough not to treat people in this way. Especially the staff at Chicago of American Airlines sucks. However we did find one person out of the lot who was courteous enough to put us on a a flight. Thanks to him but for the rest I call out to American Airlines to please deal with in a strict manner.

Wichita to Milwaukee. Did not let me pre board with my infant and stroller. No hot water available for a bottle. I called AA twice before my flight from Milwaukee to Wichita and they assured me of pre boarding and that I did not need warmers because hot water was available. My checked luggage was also damaged. After my bad experience I called agents after my flight who were so rude, would not give me their name and then disconnected. She was snarky and insinuated that I was too incompetent to write a formal review on the AA website, which I told her I had already done. I purchased insurance with my first flight and switched flights coming home to be on the same plane as my husband because of the awful experience I had from the beginning. We had to pay for an entirely new ticket instead of just the difference. Cheap, rude and none of our family and friends will ever fly with American Airlines. I would give a 0/10.

Dallas to St Louis. What a nightmare trip on American Airlines. We have had problems on every flight this trip. We have had every flight delayed or cancelled and have had to spend an additional two days in hotels and we are still not home. The way they handled the changes we're ridiculous. I have never flown on AA before and recommend that no one else does either.

Hartford to Chicago. Extremely upset with the service of American Airlines. I went up to the woman at the desk and ask nicely if it was possible to make my next flight with only 30 minutes. She then asked me â€œand who booked this flightâ€ I said myself. She then replied â€œnow there's the problem that's your fault you saw the time when you booked it.â€ I then said â€œplease you don't need to be rude I'm just trying to understand if I'm actually going to make it so I know if I should stay with the flight.â€ She then answered the phone and stopped talking to me. I've been in customer service for a while and that was the rudest encounter especially with the holidays.

Los Angeles to Dallas Ft Worth. We visited LA for Christmas. We were scheduled to fly back to Dallas 12/26/18 at 7:45. I was to check in online for that flight and received our boarding passes through email. After we returned our rental car, I then received a text message that our flight back to Dallas has been cancelled. We headed to the airport and out flight was rebooked for later that night 10:30pm LA to Reno then to Dallas. My husband had to miss work. We had to ride the bus going to our assigned gate, as soom as we arrived at the gate I received another text message that Reno to Dallas flight has been cancelled. We approached the staff and they told us to go back to ticketing counter to get our flights rebooked as there is nompoint for us flying to Reno if our final flight to Dallas is cancelled. We stood in line for quite sometime to get our flights rebooked. So our flight got rebooked again to depart evening the following day. We asked if a hotel will be provided, they said no hotel because it is cancelled due to weather. We had to pay extra for our hotel. We also had 1 checked baggage and we were told to go to baggage claim area to get it. When we got there they told us they can't locate our bag, that it might be being loaded going to Reno. Staff advised us to come back at 5:30am and said since our flight from Reno to Dallas has been cancelled they will send the bag back to LA. All our clothes and toiletries are in out checked baggage. We came back the following day and another staff said it would be a miracle if out bag will be sent back to LA, when she checked the status it said that it is headed to Dallas from Reno. Now we are here at airport, our flight back to Dallas is supposed to depart at 5:59pm 12/27/18. Few minutes after we arrived on the assigned gate, I received a text that our flight is delayed amd will be departing at 7:50pm! The delay Is not about the weather this time. American Airlines is horrible! Won't be flying with this airline ever again!

Tulsa to LaGuardia via Dallas. We will never ever fly this airline again. They left us stranded days before hurricane Irma hit the florida Keys, canceled our flight back from Austin Tx and we had to drive the last leg from Dallas airport, have made us late several times on business and pleasure waiting on a pilot to show up or maintenance. Now, they have ruined our wedding which is planned in NYC because of they cancelled our hours before for maintenance and then they changed their mind and said weather related. They were nice enough to book us a flight 2 days later! though! We have friends leaving the same airport which is Tulsa with different airlines and neither of them were cancelled nor delayed! My fiance wanted to try and stick with American since they headquarter in our local city (Tulsa), She finally said never again! We will cancel our American Airline credit card as well since we will no longer need their frequent flyer miles. Good riddance American Airlines.

Indianapolis to Cancun via Philadelphia. I flew American airlines out of Indianapolis we were the first flight out of the Airport 5:15 a.m. We boarded our plane and the pilot informed us the Co- pilot was nowhere to be found and they could not reach him. They eventually found a replacement we flew to Philadelphia we landed 10 minutes before our connection flight took off. We ran through the airport only to have the door closed in our face, plane still attached to the jetway. Along with 20 other people who were on the First flight with us. So the group of us marched to customer service to try to catch the next flight which none of us did. We were all rerouted onto multiple other flights. We were rerouted to Dallas ( this flight they also boarded the entire plane they took everyone off because they forgot to do a security check even know the plane had been sitting there for 30 hours and no one though to do that before it was suppose to fly. ) People missed cruises. My wife and I missed an entire day of our honeymoon by the time we got moved around and reached Cancun it was midnight. All because a pilot didn't show up and they couldn't hold a plane for 10 minutes to allow 20 plus people to make the flight. To top it off the airline tried to cover its ass by claiming it was a mechanical malfunction when we talked to customer service deposited the gate agent , captain and flight attendants saying the co pilot didn't show up. Never flying American Airlines again.

San Francisco to Columbia . I arrived Christmas Eve at 11: 45 p.m. to Columbia. My bag did not arrive. I received a text from American Airlines that my bag was on a later flight. I was advised to contact the airline to arrange free delivery, and when I called, I was routed to a voice mail. Now, when I call American airlines to locate my bag, I am told I will have to pay for them to deliver the bag to my address since I did not contact them within the 4 hour window, which would have been Christmas morning midnight until 4 am. I am extremely disappointed in this policy. I am being charged for a mistake made by the airlines.
New York to Charlotte. Horrible disorganized service! Half of staff tried to be nice and helpful other half have given up.

Detroit to Miami with American Airlines. Extremely unhappy with the customer service and flight operations. I purchased my flight in August to fly in December 2018 only to find a few days before my flight that they have moved the departure/arrival time to later. Additionally, are telling me my only option for me and my girlfriend is that we must purchase two new tickets (with no refund to our originally purchased tickets). This would be adding an extra $400 to my trip cost because they moved the flight time to a new time that conflicts with my schedule. Naturally, I called customer service for them to only continually repeat that they cannot refund or provide me with another flight without buying new tickets. Despite my best attempts to ask other questions, I was interrupted nearly every time I tried to speak. I told the customer representative that I understood their policy (having heard it 3-4 times by now) and wanted to ask other questions. Again, I was interrupted with "Merry Christmas" and then he proceeds to hang up the phone.

Washington to Baton Rouge via Charlotte. Awful. Flight was eventually delayed about four hours, though that information was only fed to us in hour-long chunks. The initial information concerning the delay came an hour before my scheduled departure. The cause of the delay was equipment malfunction, which American admits is entirely within its control. I was re-booked with a flight late the next day that involves an additional hour of layover, and an additional two airs in the air, in a middle seat. All escape row seats were available at the time of my rebooking, but I was explained that these are still only available for a fee. Further other earlier, direct flights, were available and offered to other travelers. No meal vouchers were offered. They offered lodging at the nearby Econolodge and Ramada, the shuttles for which were so small and infrequent that it took me 45-minutes to get from the airport to the hotel. A trip that should have taken three hours will now take 18, directly and solely as a result of American's ineptitude, and the only compensation they see fit to offer is a budget hotel, the commute to which detracts a further two hours from its use.

Newark to Orlando. We have just had bad experience with American Airlines and had to cancel our vacation, the flight was delayed and we missed connecting flight, and instead of helping and find some solution they told us to cancel our vacation. I was trying to find another person but they did not even talk to us, they were so rude and ignoring, they said they can not put us to another flight because it is overbooked and no compensation, no hotel or free meal, no sorry, will never fly with the company ever again. Stay away from them if you don't want to ruin your vacation!!!!

Miami to Newark. I've never experienced such a disgusting flying experience. I was asked to tip the curb side check in by one of the attendants. I was then told my carry-on despite compliance was needed to be checked. After asking for my jacket to be hung up in an empty coat rack, they denied me. They didn't add my TSA pre - check upon board with a child. I will never fly with American Airlines again.

Philadelphia to Tampa. They gave away our seats that we paid for when we had checked in 20 minutes prior to them boarding plane. Airport security held us up! We arrived at airport on time! First time â€œflyingâ€ American Airlines and we will never fly them again! Let us remind them that - American Airlines' conditions of carriage specify that passengers must be at their gates and ready to board 15 minutes before a scheduled departure from the US.

Charlotte to Chicago. Complete incompetence. After a 2 hour delay they have us all packed on a plane just sitting here 40 minutes and the pilot says he has no idea how much longer. Anyone that flies with American Airlines should have their head examined.

Miami to Bermuda. American Airlines did a horrific job today. First one of their flight attendants did not show up on time to depart so we didn't load up until 45 minutes after we were supposed to start. Then after boarding some passenger was not supposed to be on this plane and they had to get his or her bag from under the plane to let them off. They did a terrible job with this as it has taken 2 hours now and we are still sitting here.

Washington to Syracuse. I said the last time I flew with them, that I wouldn't again. I should have listened. I was on a flight that not only children, but adults were screaming on. There were thunderstorms the entire flight there, in which I got videos of lightening right outside of our window. Even before the flight, my fiance had clothes that made a bulge in his bag, and they made him throw away a Polo Ralph Lauren T-shirt (60$), a pair of Nike socks, and a pair of Tommy Hilflager boxers ($40), and did not give us the option to check his bag or anything like that, the agent literally pointed at a trash can. That is unacceptable on its own but let me go on. They destroyed my brand new $360 luggage set. And on top of that, My fiancÃ© needed to use the bathroom, and everyone behind us were using it no issue, we paid extra for our seats, but when my fiancÃ© got up to go to the bathroom he went to the one ahead of us ( we were in row 10 I believe, and was denied restroom service) â€œI'm sorry, can you not read the seat belt sign?â€ Is the exact words used by the flight attendant, he tried using the bathroom at the front of the aircraft ( irst class bathroom). What I am saying is, American Airlines is at the bottom, but one ahead of United. I fly 4-6 times a month, and they don't care about their guest at all.

Charlotte to South Bend. Flight left on time. Although advertised as allowing a carry on bag, there was an effort to get folks to check bags at the gate. Question, if it is allowed, why do they need to be checked - if the plane is small, allow free bag check before getting to the gate. Based upon the way the industry is geared, it seems that the best thing to do is always take the bag with you and allow it to be checked at the gate for no cost. In order to check a bag it required the removal of any medication, batteries, personal items, etc, the items one specifically packs into a carry on bag because they want to have it when they land. Also the cost for the seat (booked last minute) was extremely high (>1000) for a flight of approx. 2 hours. The service on the plane was good. I have decided to not recommend AA due to the gate experience, cost, and poor frequent flyer program.

Nashville to Ontario via Dallas. Flight was over an hour late leaving Nashville due to mechanical issues. It happens, but, this was my 4th non weather delay on 6 planes just this month. I missed my connection at DFW (after rushing to get to the gate that is always on the other far side) so they put me on a later flight. That was also delayed because the crew was late. I always try to pay extra for seats with leg room due to being a little claustrophobic and did so on both flights. My BNA to DFW seat was 16A an exit row seat. So I thought and so it said on my boarding pass. I get on the plane and it is in fact not an exit row. Okay, I'm irritated at this point, but, still going with it. The lady who helped with the flight (she was nice) from DFW to ONT put me in seat 10-A. No biggie. Window seat right(?) and I understood that I was a late passenger. I get on the plane and although it is next to the fusulage, there is no window AND the there was less leg room than the normal seats. It literally looks like there was an exit door there at some point and they just covered it up and threw a row of seats in. I'm done with AA period.

Boston to Washington DC. My flight this morning was late to take off from Boston due to unexpected snow. Because of this I was worried I wasn't going to make my connecting flight to Sarasota so I had asked a traveling flight attendant a quick question about it and I was beyond amazed by the response. Cynthia for AA went above & beyond helping me out! She walked me thru Washington terminal & even gave up her seat because it was closer so I could make my flight (I didn't) but it was her kindness and thoughtfulness that made the whole process not as stressful. Thank you Cynthia & Lisa. Because of your kind act I will always look to fly American Airlines first going forward.

Miami to St Maarten. Worst ever treatment by an airline company. You can't carry a carry-on for your 75 years old father unless paying additional fee, you can't carry a hat on your head, you can't have 1/2 pound over 50lb until repack, but carry it on your body is OK. Total weight will be the same, and more stuff inside cabin.

Amarillo to Dallas Fort Worth via Corpus Christi. The worst experience I've had with any flight. Delay after delay. Then when we finally get to Corpus we can't even get to our gate to get off the plane! Unorganized, and uneducated on their job. Lied about tires in Amarillo. Never again.

Phoenix to Newark. They've taken to splitting everyone up just to charge 80 dollars a seat to get back together. Their customer service sucks, their planes are uncomfortable and are, generally, an awful way to fly.

Nashville to New York. I'm highly disappointed by the ground service of American Airlines. I had to check in and drop luggage at the front. I waited in line for 15 min then agent asked to go to the kiosk and print boarding passes and bag tags. (Isn't that suppose to be their only job in first place to get us checked in?). Anyways I went to kiosk (another line), waited there for another 15-20 min. Finally I started to check in and it didn't allow me. I asked for help and guess what I had to go to the another counter, and another queue. Those two old ladies were the slowest people on earth, didn't had any clue how to handle computer, they had to ask for help for every customer and took them at least 5 mins to address each customer. I had to wait for another 15-20 min. I was very anxious by now as I had a flight in less than 45 min and had to go through security and all. Finally I managed to get my bags checked in, she didn't make it any easy, I had to take off few items as I my bags were overweight by 1 freaking pound. She started to give me lecture on how it can make flight imbalance and all. I was gonna ask what do you do about 400 pounds people? Do you ask them to distribute their weight across flight? Anyway god bless bna security people, I cleared security check in less than 15 min and was able to make to the flight in time.

Madrid a Miami asiento 13A. Los asientos Premium Economy en el Boeing 777 están ubicados en un área muy pequeña de aproximadamente 21/24 asientos al lado de la clase ejecutiva. Los asientos son geniales, el servicio es excelente excepto por los baños. Los pasajeros de PE no pueden usar el baño de clase ejecutiva bajo ninguna circunstancia. Las azafatas tratan a los pasajeros premium 21/24 como si no fueran seres humanos que han gastado mucho más dinero para tener la comodidad que necesitan y hacerlos caminar unas 60 filas en un pasillo muy angosto completamente lleno de gente y permanecer en un interminable hacer fila para usar un baño muy sucio y súper pequeño, lo cual es realmente un desafío y volver a sus asientos en Educación Física, lo que significa caminar 60 filas hacia atrás en un pasillo muy estrecho con muchas personas de pie. He estado viajando en un PE en Virgin Atlantic y también en Air France, donde los pasajeros de PE son tratados como una clase prioritaria. La próxima vez no más American Airlines, ¡hay un mejor servicio por ahí!

Norfolk to Dallas Ft Worth. Overall experience as far as customer service at the counter, flight attendants, comfort, and flight was good. But when something goes wrong they go to their little policies and leave you hanging dry. My flight got canceled due to weather no obviously that's out of their control which I completely understand, but then they book me to another flight in less then 24 hours to the same city where it currently is snowing at the time and where the weather channel is reporting heavy snow for the next few days. When they basically say that this is the only next available flight we obviously take it, but it also gets canceled. I've traveled with Allegiant and have had flights canceled due to weather, but they provided a hotel and even vouchers for our next flight. So we got stuck for two days paid hotel, food, and also missed work for two days. I guess every airline has a different policy, just some are better than others.

Springfield to Albuquerque via Dallas Ft Worth. Flew American today and I am so happy that I regularly fly Southwest!! My flight was delayed because of a ground hold, arrived late into Dallas, was told to â€˜run' to the gate to get my connection and they closed the door as I walked up. I'm then put on another flight, in a coach seat, even though I paid for extra legroom and get to board last. Thanks for your attention to detail American and for taking great care of your customers. Like they even care?

Ft Wayne to Charlotte. What helpful and pleasant customer service associates. I purchased a non refundable ticket 10 days before the hurricane hit North Carolina in September. American Airlines was kind enough to offer me a travel voucher. I booked for November and then my grandfather died and yet again American Airlines gave me a travel voucher. Above and beyond I love the direct flight from FWA to CLT! And now on will purchase travel insurance

Los Angeles to Salt Lake City. My wife and I were to catch AA flt 6036 to LAX leaving at 11:59. Before 8:00 AM we got an E-Mail from AA saying the flight was on time. At 9:00 AM the baggage agent told us the flight was 20 minutes delayed. The inbound aircraft never left the ground! We were told at about 12:00 that the flight had been canceled but there was plenty of room on flt 3401 leaving at 2:30 PM (too late to catch the ship). The gate attendant knew that the flight had been canceled but waited until all competitive flights had left before the announcement. This was a clear case of canceling a lightly booked flight and consolidating it with a later flight to save money. A classic case of AA's "customer be damned" business philosophy. Never again with AA

Atlanta to Miami. The distance was not long but I will never fly with them again they have bad delays. I took this flight from Atlanta to Miami to get on my cruise ship the plane had a delay which made me miss the boat after calling for several hours to customer service I couldn't get no help. Customer service continued to hang up, be rude, was non caring they made me feel less as a customer saying it's nothing they can do while there policy states â€œif we have delays we will accommodate you on the next flightâ€ - they did not, all they said was sorry buy a new ticket which is inconsiderate while they mad me miss my next connection.

Phoenix to San Antonio. Changed boarding gate # with no announcement. Almost missed flight. Staff was rude when asked about it. Will never fly American again. There was no concern that I almost missed my flight and that others may have missed it all together. Horrible customer service.

Austin to Chicago. Have flown many other airlines in the last several years and I really can't say I thought one outdid American. They have really improved a lot over the last several years. Better seats, better planes, better lounges, more routes and generally respond well to feedback. The basic economy and the choice to make status much more difficult are unfortunate and weak in their copy cat nature but we shall see how they play out.

San Jose to Nashville via DFW. The customer service of this airline has consistently been pretty terrible and rude. I was placed on standby for a flight and went to the gate desk a little early and told to come back after the current flight departed. Understandable, no problem (with the exception of the slight attitude the gate attendant had with my mere presence). I came back when my flight was supposed to be serviced, and again told the flight just needed to pull out of the gate and she could help me, again with annoyance that I was back. I stand back a couple feet to make it clear that I am ready when she is, and then proceed to listen to the gate attendant talk about vacation, travel, all other chitchat etc., for 30 minutes - ignoring that I'm clearly waiting for her. I approach and tell her I'd like my seat assignment, and she breaks from her social hour, and throws a boarding pass at me that was already printed! Why was she waiting to just hand it off? This employee had no interest in doing a key component of her job, in just being generally pleasant like a normal human being, and instead wanted to just loaf and chat with colleagues as her main job - all else an annoyance. Most American flights I've had were delayed, and I only reluctantly booked again because I have a lot of travel this month and wanted to stretch a budget. If you can, pay a bit extra for any other airline to get you to your destination and be treated with some semblance of respect along the way.

Montego Bay to Boston via Miami / New York. Worst airline I've ever flown with. First could not get seats together with my husband. Was told & desk they don't sit family members together because they want you to pay to sit together. That we buy the â€œairâ€ not the seats. If we want to sit together more $$, even though empty seats together still available. Second booked our flight directly from Boston to Montego Bay Jamaica and back. Return flight from Montego Bay to Miami to LaGuardia NY to Boston. Left Sandals at 4 Am. Cannot for the life of me figure out Why they sent us this route when there were direct flights with empty seats from Miami to zBoston. For us to change was $400 additional. In LaGuardia now flight delayed 2 hours. We've been traveling since 8am will not arrive in Boston till 9:15 but every time we look at monitor delayed more. Horrible experience. Will never fly this airline again. Staff not sympathetic

London to Guadalajara via Dallas. I'm unsure if American used to have high customer service standards, but they certainly do not have them now. They are the worst airline I have travelled with, especially as a Business customer. The planes are outdated, I was given drinks tokens in the lounge, my screen broke from London to Dallas and it needed 3 follow ups from me to get a tablet instead. My flight from Dallas to Washington was deplaned due to an issue, I then wasn't allowed back into the Lounge I had already been in. There were many people on the plane who had already come from a cancelled plane. I get the impression that this is routine for American. In a week period I flew on 4 American flights, and each of them had an issue of some description. Their Business and First Lounges are dated, lack facilities and food (especially compare to Emirates which are brilliant). Giving it 3 stars because I made it to the destinations eventually, and I had a particularly good steward from Dallas-Guadalajara. However none of the trips were relaxing, despite paying for First or Business.

New York to London. It was a night flight. I hate the night flights because I am not able to sleep on the plane. There were two meals. A hot and a cold. My place was in the 24th row. The flight is 7 hours long it is acceptable.

London to Miami. My seat was in the 42nd row. For the 10 hours the seat and legroom is very uncomfortable. They offered a hot a cold food and an ice cream. They had given beverages very often. The food was average. The stewardess was very very helpful and kind.

Miami to Washington. The interior of the plane was brand new. The windows are very low, any other thing is perfect. Clean carpet, seat, restroom. Helpful and kind staff. Cheap price. Fast boarding. They offered free, water and biscuit. Legroom and seat is enough for this 3 hours flight.

Portland to Pensacola via Washington. Worst treatment ever. I expressed to the gate attendant that I will miss my connection since the first flight was late. Totally dismissed me. We arrived late then parked on the runway waiting on a gate. Spent forever in line for customer service. Then they tried not to put me up in a hotel for the night. They rescheduled me for the following morning. No dinner, no breakfast. Next day the desk attendant was rude to me when I asked to get a seat closer to the do so as not to have to walk for long. Treated me as a leper because I was flying economy! Very hurtful and condescending. Last time I fly with AA. I'll spend some more I fly with a decent airline

Valparaiso to Lansing via Washington. Absolutely horrid excuse for customer service or an airline in general. Every flight delayed due to incompetence and not a single employee that can answer any question. I will never waste money on such a trash airline again. How pathetic that Spirit is now better than American. Save your time save your money fly anything but American 0/10

Seattle to Cancun via Charlotte. American Airlines has the worst customer service. We were flying on vacation from Seattle to Cancun - 1 stop in Charolette, North Carolina. I chose this flight because it was a red eye flight beginning at 10:30 PM to allow us almost a full extra day of vacation in Cancun. The A321 airplane they used on our first flight was horrible. No in-flight entertainment system, no charging area in your seats and the seat space was cramped. On our second flight on our way to Cancun we were on the tarmac when the pilot notified us of an issue with the plane where we would have to return to the gate for a 20 mins fix. Once at the gate, we were told the paperwork would delay us longer and they would find another aircraft. After another 2 hour wait the flight was just cancelled. No notification at all. 280 people began scrambling to find another flight. Needless to say they sent us to customer service where they had major computer issues and just rebooked us all on another flight the next day. This was after 2 hours of standing in line. They put us up in a hotel by the airport, with no bags, and a $12.00 per person food voucher only for use at the airport with no restaurants but a small Starbucks for food. They made a meager attempt to give us 15,000 miles for our inconvenience but that doesn't cover our lost day of vacation, hotel fees for a day in Cancun, and additional food and Uber expenses in Charlotte. In attempts to get additional reimbursement for our hotel fees etc, they declined and said we should have gotten travel insurance. RI am not going to accept their 15,000 miles because I never plan to fly this airline ever again.

Washington DCA to Chicago. I just want to express my gratitude to 2 American Airlines customer service employees at Reagan National airport in DC. I am dealing with a vision disability and the both went the extra mile to help me change my flight and get me the proper info and they did it with a great attitude. Thank you, your patience and kindness went above and beyond!

Chicago to Boston. American Airlines is the most inefficient and disrespectful airline out there. They are late, and today they got to my limit by canceling my first flight at 3pm for no reason, they also expected me to get on a different flight to Boston vÃ­a Florida. After I discussed for 20 minutes with a very disrespectful customer service assistant she proceeded to give me a ticket to a flight straight to Boston 3 hours later (keep in mind she said several times it wasn't possible to fly straight to Boston today, disregarding the fact that I paid 700$ in order to fly direct). The 6pm flight got cancelled after many hours of delay and now they won't give me my carry on bag which they made me check back, and the cherry on top is that they expect me to leave tomorrow to Philadelphia and on Tuesday to Boston. Of course I am expected to pay for the hotel because that is the American Airlines way! Do yourself a favor and stay away from this so called airline.

Charlotte to Philadelphia. The crew were late to get on board, we left over a hour late from CLT. Then once we arrived into Philadelphia there were no ground crew waiting. Sitting on the ground as we wait â€œfor the ground manager to assemble a crewâ€, so the pilot said, â€œAmerican doesn't usually hold these standards". I took this same flight last Friday CLT - PHL and no ground crew where ready too. It's a huge same American. You need to get yourself sorted. Bad hospitality half the time, late the rest.

Washington to Miami via Washington. The flight to Miami was pretty good. Staff were courteous and attentive. The flight back was extremely disappointing. The seats were smaller and on an older model plane, and the staff barely attended to us. The nuts were lukewarm, and our trays were not emptied until the flight was almost over. The staff was more interested in talking to each other and playing on their phones than assisting anyone on the flight. Needless to say, we will not be flying American Airlines ever again. The service and level of comfort is vastly different than what we experienced on United Airlines and we will not be choosing American Airlines for future travel.

Los Angeles to Honolulu. Good Flight, but nothing special. Flight was on time from push back to landing. Bags also arrived very quickly which is a nice surprise from AA the mainland operations could learn something from the Islands on how to get a plane unloaded and bags arriving quickly. Plane is showing it's age with well wore seats. IFE worked great. I did not try the WiFi so I don't know if it worked over water. My disappointment with the flight is it was only OK, nothing special like the Hawaii flights use to be. FA did the bare minimum to make it through the flight again, nothing special. Meal was again, ok, nothing great. If you want a special experience for your trip to the islands, I would recommend Hawaiian Airlines and stay off the big three.

Phoenix to Austin. My review is for my son who who bumped out of his seat on his flight home from Phoenix to Austin. He had early checked in online 24 hours earlier and already had his boarding pass on his IPhone when he arrive at the gate. He arrived at the gate 15 minutes before the plane was due to depart. The person at the boarding pass scanner told my son your seat was just given away to a standby passenger. The gate agent gave my sons seat away right at the time my son arrived telling my son he was late but he was not late. So the gate agent was looking to bump someone off the flight in order to accommodate a middle aged couple maybe because they had made some sort of excuse. It was not right for the American Airlines gate agent to give my son seat away as he already had his boarding pass and they could have let him board but would not. They claimed he was late to the gate but he was right there while the gate agent was giving away his seat to another standby passenger.

Chicago to London. Food and service was good. Seats are comfy. Good flight overall. Airline needs to take better care of their passengers belongings, both mine and my fiances luggage were completely ruined. We now have to buy new luggage. My suitcase had only been used once previously. Very disappointed.

Miami to London Heathrow. Check in and bag drop were easy as a Premium Economy customer can use Priority where the lines are very short. This is conveniently located next to the Priority TSA security lane that I was able to use so I was airside in MIA about 15 mins after dropping my bag. Once airside, because I'm a Oneworld Sapphire cardholder, I was eligible to use a lounge. Whilst AA has more than one lounge in MIA I headed for the best one which is the Flagship Lounge. Lots of space and different seating areas and points for food and beverage to avoid bottlenecks. The hot food was superb and indulged in a little bit of this together with some champagne and really good Californian red wine. About a 5 min walk to board and most others had already boarded so there was no line at the gate, even though I had priority boarding if needed. The Premium Economy cabin is small, only 3 or 4 rows, with a bathroom right in front of the first row. I had no problem placing my hand baggage in the locker. The seats are very new and comfortable. I flew out Main Cabin Extra (MCE) just a few days earlier so could easily compare the seating. The IFE screen is noticeably bigger than coach as is the width of the seat. The legroom is very comfortable, with a foot rest, but to be honest only a couple of inches more than MCE, but several more than Main Cabin. The Premium Economy recline is really good, so you can create a fairly relaxed seating position overall. Proper ear surrounding headsets give a better sound offering for the movies, which are the same as offered in coach. We were offered drinks and pretzels within 30 mins of departure and the offering was the same as coach. Not much time passed before the main meal came out with more drinks. The food presentation was good, solid crockery and metal cutlery. But after this point, is where it fell flat. The main course appears to be bespoke for Premium Economy, presumably as an enhanced offering. A number of my fellow passengers had pre-ordered special dietary meal. There is also an option to pre-order your main meal even if not for dietary reasons. I had not done this. As a result I was offered no choice and given this bland, tasteless, protein free vegetable risotto. It is the most disappointing long haul inflight main course meal I have had in all my travels. Even more so because I was in Premium Economy. Thank goodness I'd earlier eaten in their Flagship Lounge. About an hour before arrival a light breakfast was served consisting of a fresh fruit plate, banana yoghurt and a small cinnamon pastry with tea or coffee and juices. This was fine, although a hot beverage refill would have been welcome. Despite the disappointing dinner, with the good seat comfort I got about 5 hours sleep. Bag delivered promptly at Heathrow with no issues. My verdict on AA Premium Economy: slick on the ground, very comfortable in the air, but didn't see the premium in the food and beverage offering. I'd fly it again depending on the extra cost over Main Cabin.

London to Miami. I was able to pre-reserve a seat in a Main Cabin Extra row as I'm a Oneworld Sapphire cardholder so this was a great start. Check-in bag drop was a breeze as I was able to use the Priority Check in area even though in Economy. Quickly through Heathrow T3 Fast Track. Then a choice of lounge in T3 for Oneworld (BA, AA, Cathay and the new Qantas lounge). I was entitled to use the AA Admirals Club, but opted instead to use the Cathay Pacific lounge which was great. Once on board I got settled in quickly and was really impressed with the extra legroom I got in Main Cabin Extra and some of the lockers are designated as reserved for these customers. The inflight food and beverage offering is the same as everyone else in Main Cabin. But I can't really grumble. I got a drink and a sweet biscuit within an hour of departure. For Lunch, which followed shortly afterwards, portions were sufficient and the main course very tasty. The FA's were generous with the wine and we're happy to give refills on request. About an hour out from landing a hot small pizza calzone was served with a choice of drinks. The entertainment offering was average with a reasonable selection of modern release movies and the screen and sound were fine. With the exception of leg room, which exceeded my expectations, this flight lived up to what I would expect for a long haul international economy flight. I'd fly AA international again.

Hartford to Chicago. I accidentally booked a flight for 7.30pm not 7.30am. I paid 200.00 to change the flight and an additional 300.00 because the rate changed. I arrived to the airport to leave at 7.30am and the plane broke down. The repair took all day and we ended up leaving at 730pm after all and they will not refund the additional amount paid to take the early flight that I was not able to get on. They nickle and dime you for everything but do not take care of the customer when they are at fault. I have flown 13 times since May and this is how they treat me.

Las Vegas to Philadelphia. When I purchased my tickets, I forgot to secure my seats. By the time I remembered, my seat on my outbound flight was an isle and on the return flight a middle. Although I am slightly claustrophobic, I felt I could manage the return if I kept my mind busy. Well, I was wrong. I will remember my return flight today forever. While waiting for my boarding group number to load, the airline informed us they were looking for 10 people to give up their seats as they were overbooked. They offered a $1,000 voucher. Wanting to get home sooner, I boarded the flight and sat down in my middle seat after the isle passenger moved aside. Once I sat down and with the other passenger next to me, my claustrophobia kicked in and my heart started to accelerate. I felt a cold sweat and a feeling of being trapped. I tried hard to read a book but knew after 1 minute that it wasn't working. I asked the passenger to get up and quickly exited the seat. I rushed up to the stewardess and told her I had a problem. I explained I was having a panic attack due to the middle seat position and my claustrophobia. She immediately looked me in the eye and told me everything would be fine. She told me her father also had the same fear. She helped me out of the plane past the line of entering passengers and told me to take deep breaths. She then went back inside the plane and asked the passenger in the isle seat if they minded moving to the middle. Unfortunately they said no, so she took my carry on bag and escorted me back to the check-in area to be placed in an isle seat on another plane. Now the story does not end there. Because the plane was overbooked, a passenger seated on the isle in the emergency row decided to deplane. Rather than placing another passenger in that seat they brought me back in the plane. The flight was wonderful and I had no further anxiety problems. I even got home on time to see my family. I feel American Airlines and the stewardess went above and beyond. I will remember the kindness they showed me today for the rest of my life.

New York to Freeport via Miami. Absolute poor experience from end to end. When we checked in, the boarding passes didn't work when we entered security. Our re-check-in was done with an attitude of me not understanding how things work - which isn't very customer service minded. After we arrived at our destination, 2 of 3 checked in luggage's missed our flight (we had 2.5h layover) and was not found until the day after. Neither of these experiences were managed well, and no one (!!) from the additional assistance during check-in (and re-check-in) to the baggage service representative (via phone) had any empathy or a customer service mentality. Please note, we were traveling with an infant. On the way back to our home, we experienced an unpleasant situation while boarding the first airplane. We were kindly asked to check in a carry on at the counter, and we explained that our carry on had baby equipment required for a long layover (blankets, harness etc.). A classical superviser-type (by attitude) employee from AA interrupted the conversation, without any respect of existing explanation (or emphathy for that matter), and ordered us to check in our carry on. If we did not, she told us we wouldn't be allowed to board the airplane. â€œNext flight you're taking is at 6PMâ€ was her exact words. This was said without even trying to solve our issue! It contributed to the unpleasant situation we experienced at the gate. Worth mentioning we were flying with carry on allowed as part of our ticket. We unwillingly gave up our carry on (incl. important baby stuff) only to discover that half of the overhead bins were empty when boarding was complete. I am frequently using AA for business trips - it's though no longer my first choice when other options are available. Participated in the post flight questionnaires provided by AA. I honestly gave up after answering questions for 10 minutes - also realized I was only through 1/3 of the steps.
Orange County to Gainesville via Miami. The airline had no control over the weather delays, but my flight landed late which made me late to my connecting flight home. I had to stay overnight in Miami
Topeka to Meridian via Chicago. This flight was outstanding. Seating was comfortable and service outstanding! I highly recommend American Airlines! Will not hesitate to fly with American again.

Oklahoma City to Dallas. American Airlines is a disaster! Let's review: 1) Plane delayed 30 minutes from OKC to Dallas. 2) Plane delayed 20 minutes after landing in Dallas. 3) Arrive 2 minutes late to catch our 2nd AA flight with 10 other people from our first AA flight! 4) AA didn't wait for us 10 to catch 2nd flight and even left the gate ~7 minutes before scheduled. We know because we watched the plane back out. 5) Lost $600 in travel costs and 30 hours of my life. 6) This airline is by far the worst, from an organizational standpoint. It's apparent from every aspect of the way their organization is run.

Pittsburgh to Charlotte. Delayed on the runway for over an hour and they wouldn't provide me with a drink of water while on the ground with no actual reason. I had a very dry sore throat and this made it very uncomfortable. They didn't even seem to show any sort of empathy for me or my request. Never had good experiences with this airline and this will only add to my list.

Los Angeles to Kona. American Airlines is the worst! I arrived to check in my bag 40 minutes before my flight. They have a strict policy that you have to check a bag within 45 minutes of your flight. If you don't they force you to buy another buy and get on anther flight! They provided zero alternative options for getting my bag there on time. They didn't let me get on my flight and take the chance my bag would be delivered on another flight. Plus, they have retarded bag fees and their customer service phone line had a 45 minute wait!

Las Vegas to Atlanta. The worst experience ever that I received. For someone whose scared to fly I believe they need to be better at their service. If something going wrong with the flight I believe that there should be communication being given to passengers. If a passenger explained that their flight leaves at a certain time, like 20 min from now what you don't do is tell the person whose seated way in the back to hurry up and make it to they flight in order to make it. When their difficulty happening on the plane. There was no type of order. To be paying for a flight I do wish to get treated right and not being disrespected to and treated as if I'm nothing.

Newark to Phoenix. I fly almost every week for work and never had a positive experience with American Airlines. I paid for preferred seating for a window seat and there's no window in my aisle, and they also made me check my carry on bag, which they do every single time regardless of size. I have also had more delays with American Airlines than any other airline. I am an American Airlines member and cardholder and still am treated poorly. On top of all of that, it is completely impossible to get in touch with customer service. Would not recommend.

Lihue to Phoenix. I booked and paid for a first class seat. When I get to the airport they downgraded me without my approval to a coach seat. I was told it was because they overbooked first class. When I paid for first class there was only two seats booked at the time. I was informed my downgrade was because the other travels had a higher status with American then I do. Seriously? This is how American treats people. Never again

Pensacola to Boston via Charlotte. I recently flew American and the flight resulted in a change to a further airport, a delay in the new flight due to airport maintenance that was known about but not conveyed until after the flight was supposed to take off and finally an hour wait while they retrieved our gate checked bags and found us a hotel. Each individual I spoke to was very polite but ultimately the company policy made this a difficult,exhausting, and ultimately very costly trip with lost days of work.

Denver to Charlotte. Waited at gate for paperwork (as per captain) Made us almost miss connection. After standing at the luggage carousel for 30 min, we realized our luggage was not there. Walked all over the airport trying to find a AA employee. Found a security girl that directed us back to luggage pick up. Found AA baggage office, they say they will deliver my baggage some time at night. Tired from getting up early and flying all day, I am now expected to wait up for this.

Baltimore to Dallas with American Airlines. Paid for inflight internet and it barely works. Waste of $12. Not the first time either. Airline has turned into something like Spirit Airlines, nickel and diming you throughout the process. I'm already looking at other options for travel. My retirement certainly won't be this brand. I'll use my 157000 miles (hopefully they won't ruin that too) and get out.

Orlando to Orange County via Dallas. My flight from Orlando to Dallas was delayed, but I was able to obtain a seat on another American flight and make my Dallas connection. However, a computer program determined I would not be able to make the connection, cancelled my seat on the flight to Orange County, and assigned me to a flight the following morning. I received an automated email asking that I accept the next day flight or request another, which I did not respond to since I was able to get on another flight. I did discuss this with the gate agent in Orlando who apparently cannot override the computer's erroneous conclusion. American Airlines Customer Relations responded in writing to my complaint, but stands steadfast by the computer rather than the customer. American Airlines has attempted to reorganize from bankruptcy with a new logo and some new planes (although they remain among the older fleets). The Admirals Club staff are clearly trained to smile and great and offer assistance to customers. Unfortunately the Customer Relations staff appear stuck in the bankruptcy period, little imagination or motivation to attract and maintain customers.
Baltimore to Dallas Ft Worth. American has become the most unpleasant travel experience I've ever had. They just collect my money and treat me like a number

Miami to Zurich via Philadelphia. Second time the plane for the connecting flight suddenly had technical issues and we had to wait more than 3 hours for them to find a new plane. And of course every flight is overbooked and delayed because they have to find people who are willing to take a different flight. Also, better don't think it will get any better once you are on the plane. The cabin staff is mostly in a bad mood and ignore you. Definitely not worth saving a couple of dollars flying with this airline!

Medford to Los Angeles. Got here 2 hours early. Needed a wheelchair, waited 45 minutes before anyone came to help me. Still waiting for help. Requested wheel chair while making my reservation. Called to see if the airlines got my request. Got to Medford airport which is tiny. Still no wheelchair. No one was willing to help. Very scary feeling, when you're handicapped. If it wasn't one of two airlines that fly direct, I would never fly with them.

Washington to Milwaukee. My husband and I purchased airline tickets together months before, but when we checked in and received our seat assignment our seats were nowhere near each other! In all the years we have traveled together we have never been split up until this flight. I think this is terrible and a poor business practice. I will never fly this airline ever again. Airlines are a dime a dozenâ€”there are more options out there than just you, American Airlines. Avoid unless you are traveling solo. This is not a family friendly airline.

New York to Buenos Aires. The Flagship Lounge at JFK terminal 8 was very nice, with good selection of foods and wines. Check-in and boarding went smoothly. The seat was very comfortable. Cabin service, though was not at the level of premium Asian carriers, was pretty good. Cabin crew always showed up with a smile, and one can clearly saw that they were trying to provide upscale service. The big letdown was the food. I had better meals in economy with other carriers, and that was the first time I left my meal mostly untouched. Dessert was, however, pretty good, so that became my dinner. I had the exact same experience on my return flight from Buenos Aires, so this seemed consistent. What puzzled me was how AA let this minor thing ruined all other improvements they made. If AA simply improves in-flight catering the way they did with their lounges, I think they can be a 4-star (or even 5-star) airline.

New York to Miami. The plane is old, the luggage compartments are small and there is barely any leg room. There are no screens or TV and the service is horrendous. We are waiting over 25 minutes to get a gate in Miami and they dont let my children go to the bathroom. The flight up to New York from Miami was a disaster, they kept us on the plane for an hour with ac. Truly a horrific flight and airline.

New York to Dallas Ft Worth. This was my first time flying American, as I am usually a Delta flyer, and this trip left much to be desired. The staff at the gates are very snippy, impatient, and borderline rude. I actually got angry at the treatment I felt myself and other passengers were receiving. The flights either left 45 minutes late or pulled away from the gate 15 minutes early. The seats feel like church pews. They kept it freezing in the cabin and when i asked for a blanket (which is standard with Delta) the stewardess informed me that I would need a business or first class ticket to get one. I paid regular price) and strongly considered just purchasing a one way ticket back to California with Delta to avoid the extra grief of flying with American. Very poor experience.

Dallas to Las Vegas. Airline is trash and disrespectful. They took our crew and put on another plane. I am never flying this airline, I prefer Frontier. We were given a $12.00 food voucher. They lied to us twice about a crew and we had no choice but to spend the night. They will not reimburse for a hotel but will give vouchers. Everybody had bad stories of this airline.

Boston to Miami. American Airlines never fails to disappoint. It has gotten to the point where I book a flight a night before I would like to arrive because the chances of them getting me in on time is less than 10%. Every time it is due to a â€œmaintenance problemâ€ so I do not even get compensation for the time they have wasted. The only reason I am still buying flights from them is because they are the only airline that has a direct flight from Boston to Miami. This is the last time I make this mistake. It would actually be faster for me to have a connecting flight than to take this direct flight. This particular time the flight was delayed 2.5 hours. They made us get off the plane so that we could reboard in 20 min. I am still waiting for AA to give me a voucher or some sort of compensation for the last time I flew with them when my flight was delayed for 3 hours and as a result I lost my AA connecting flight (with an original 1hr layover) - they rebooked me to take another AA flight after an 8 hour layover. I ended up getting a new ticket on a different airline where my layover wouldn't be half a day long.

Denver to Dallas. I felt like I was targeted during boarding from Denver to Dallas on 11/2/2018. They require you to check your bag at their notice without the consideration of my needs and the reasoning why I didn't pay to have my baggage checked. I was boarding the airplane when the ladies checking my boarding pass took my carry-on baggage. Their intention was just to check any bag without asking the traveler if there's a need. I asked for valet check in service and I was told no, but at the same time another traveler was granted such. AA assumes all responsibilities in the event somethings happens to me. After departing the airplane, I noticed several baggage were the same size or even bigger than my baggage but I was the first to pull to the side. There were even travelers with more than 2 items boarding the airplane but they were not asked to consolidate or to check one.

Vancouver à Lima via Dallas Fort Worth. J'ai été très satisfait de tous les aspects des deux étapes du vol vers Lima. Les départs ont été ponctuels, les sièges et l'espacement des sièges étaient étonnamment confortables et les repas étaient au-dessus de la moyenne. L'équipage était tous sympathique, courtois et efficace. Le seul défaut , ce qui ne m'a pas dérangé, c'est que les divertissements en vol étaient extrêmement limités.

Philadelphia to Northwest Arkansas via Chicago. Airline departs Philadelphia on time. Lands in Chicago at 0855hrs. The plane sits on the tarmac for 30min causing me to miss my connecting flight. I ran to my connecting gate to be told the gate was closed. I could see people inside the door. I knocked on the door to let them know I was outside. No response. I found a 'supervisor' and complained. She said she could put me on the next flight but said the problem was mine. I informed the supervisor that the airlines set the times. American Airlines is never on time. Never! American Airlines has got to be the worst domestic airline ever.

Los Angeles to Charlotte. Why does it seem that every time I fly on an American Airlines operated flight the planes are broken. I'm always delayed due to something not working on the plane. Today, I was booked on a 0830 trip to CLT, but that didn't happen because it was broken. So after 3 and a half hours we got on the next flight out and surprise, surprise, that ones not working either. Thanks American Airlines for holding me up hours on my trips constantly.

Dublin to Orlando via Philadelphia. I have an extremely bad fear of flying. The cabin crew could not have been more accommodating from the first minute. Re-seated us at no charge to a more comfortable section at the middle of the plane, and checked in regularly, explaining every noise and bump. Fantastic service and left me feeling incredibly grateful. No complaints about the comfort or level of service, all top quality for a bargain price.

Honolulu to St. Louis. Horrible customer service. Employee at the gate held up the line and made me â€œconsolidateâ€ my purse into my husbands laptop bag. 2 people get a total 2 carry ons and 2 personal items. We had 4 as we were allowed. No need to be rude and bossy. It's not necessary. Flying is already stressful and uncomfortable. I don't need rude employees making it worse. Flight was out of food. Dr Pepper. Both my original and return flights offered WiFi for a fee. Wasn't able to use it. It was disconnected one way and cut out the other route. But they sure did take my money. Never American. Never again

London to Chicago. I've arrived to Chicago and I realized that the stroller I was bringing to my grand daughter was broken. I contact American Airlines 2 days after my arrival to Chicago. They finally got back to me after 3 weeks! To make a long story short they refused to compensate me for something because I didn't have the receipt from the stroller. In other works, according to AA, we have to keep all the receipts for purchases above $150 until the time we die just in case we will travel with them and they broke or destroy our personal items. This is unfortunately the customer service companies like American Airlines offer to their customers. Now, I have to buy a new stroller and apologize to my 3 year old grand daughter why she never received her favorite stroller. Shame on you AA.

Tucson to Tokyo via Los Angeles. I recently took an AA round trip ticket to Japan. On all segments of the flight my husband and I never were seated together although we were booked together. You had to pay minimum an extra $40 for assigned seating. Those weren't cheap tickets to start with. Throughout the trip we had the chance to witness and talk to a number of couples who were experiencing the same thing. One case was so obvious. Where there were 3 seats, an American couple was split by a Japanese girl who was sitting in the middle. They asked her if she wanted to sit by the window and managed to travel side by side. In the automated check in stalls at the airport it was rather irritating how AA kept requesting whether we wanted to upgrade class, seating, meals etc. That is so low class behavior. I personally am not looking forward to travelling AA again.

Chicago to Raleigh Durham. This airline nickel & dimes passengers for everything and penalizes us for purchasing an economy ticket by putting you in a middle seat in the back of the plane when you can finally check in online. My flight to Chicago I got stuck in the middle next to a non-stop burping passenger

Charlotte to New York. The worst customer service I have ever experienced. This is the 3rd time I have tried this airline within the last year and for sure will be my last! Every flight was delayed which caused me to lose out on a $4,000 training. I am beyond upset I also called just to see if I can postpone my outbound ticket so I could make up the lost time no one returned my call. Then at the gate I asked for at least a simple seat upgrade and was denied this company does not care about their customers at all. Never fly American Airlines!

Washington to Miami. American Airlines is consistent with bad customer service, from the phone representatives to the the ticketing agents. You need to train your employees on proper communication etiquette and how to carry out good service. Each AA representative I have dealt with has been extremely unprofessional and just have an overall sense of not caring about the service they provide.

Washington to Houston via Dallas Ft Worth. Evening departure on an older 737-800 with no entertainment system and average service nothing to mention about it, connected with a much newer 737-800 with an entertainment system. I must mention the super friendly flight attendant who was super pleasant and helpful.

New York JFK to Nashville. The most miserable flying experience I have ever had. The flight home was incredibly uncomfortable. It was so hot on the plane that the chocolates that we had bought in the airport melted. I will never fly again. Staff was less than friendly and would be better off working for TSA. Complete waste of money.

Miami to Atlanta. Dont Ever fly with them. They lied to us on the phone when we called prior to our flight saying we would be able to keep our return flight if we chose to purchase a flight earlier than the original one. The day we went to check in they said they had cancelled our flight, wouldn't give refund, said we lied about ever calling. We have proof that we called. Said they wouldnt help us that the basic economy doesn't work like that. We followed their rules to a T and called prior to make sure and then told the day it was cancelled that we cant miss the first flight, although again it was approved ahead of time. They didn't even act caring, had to wait extreme times on the phone to talk to anyone. No one was helpful or even admitted they cancelled it, kept blaming someone else. If you want help dont fly with them! So were stuck on miami with no way home to my kids, unless we wanna pay another $360 just to fly home cheapest possible with them.

Jacksonville to Boston via Charlotte. If American Airlines didn't have such good credit card offers for mileage accrual, I would reconsider flying with them. I am a regular user of American because of convenience of routes and schedules, but I find myself turned off by their oddly convoluted (and long) boarding times, less than helpful ground staff, and overwhelmingly apparent cost-cutting. I purchased a premium seat online for one segment of my trip, and was charged accordingly. However, upon check-in, I was told the payment was not received and that I'd have to repay the $41.60 fee, and no effort was made to rectify the problem on the check-in staff's part. Dispute is still ongoing with my bank. Let's move onto the actual product though. The two aircraft I flew were definitely showing their age, but the new leather seating and adjustable headrests (737-800 models) were greatly appreciated and of good quality. Arrival and departure times were more than punctual and flight attendants were friendly enough, but the borderline harassment that ensues when 6 minutes of intercom time is devoted to credit card advertisement is definitely a turn-off. I didn't use the wifi, but I did use the stream-to-device entertainment, which worked well. There was also traditional overhead monitors available on the 737-800, playing standard sitcom fare. Overall it's an average experience, but a few factors such as aging planes and odd advertisements, along with cheap biscotti snacks and pricey buy-on-board options leave just the slightest bad taste in my mouth.

Philadelphia to Rome. On October 10, 2018, I had one of the most unpleasant experiences, in a long career in flying. When I checked in for AA 718, over two hours before the departure, I noticed that our seats were not assigned on the boarding passes. I thought this odd since I had selected our seats and paid extra for those seat selections. I checked the AA website and saw that a note that the flight was delayed 30 minutes, but I did not receive an email alert. We went to the assigned gate and 20 minutes before scheduled take off, it was announced that our flight was delayed, the gate was changed, and the plane was changed. Our seats, which I selected and paid $282 for extra leg room (it was a 7.5 hour flight), were not honored and we were assigned seats in the rear of the plane where we could enjoy the roar of the engines and a hint of jet fuel for the duration of the flight. AA's code sharing partner, British Airways, also foisted the "change of plane" and doomed us to horrible seats. I have a suspicion there was some consolidation of flights going on here. I checked the flight the day before and many seats were still available. The upshot of this is that I believe that AA changed to a plane with fewer seats and that our "guaranteed" seats were not honored. I am left wondering who sat in our seats, and why we were selected for inferior seats. If I am unable to feel confident that the seats I select and pay for will be available, why would I ever utilize American Airlines again? Please persuade me as to why I should fly American Airlines again, after this dismal performance.

Philadelphia to Los Angeles. I had enough with American Airlines. It's now #2 on the list of worst airlines I ever used (#1 is Wamos, a Spanish airline). Their personnel on the ground (and in the air) is actually pretty helpful and their machines fairly simple to use, at least from my experience. But it's once you're onboard that you realize your mistake. I paid $1030 for a flight from LA to Reading and back, the same price I would pay for a trip to Europe, which is twice the distance. You'd think for that price you can get a minimum quality, even on economy. Wrong. For a start, you pay $30 for your first check-in luggage, and it grows exponentially! Totally outrageous. What this does, it makes everybody bringing carry-ons, overcharging the cabin with carry-on luggage, making it hard to find space above your seat for your luggage, so you have to put it in a totally different area (what a hassle to get it when you exit the plane!). No food for the whole flight (Yes, AA, I don't call food a couple of pretzels and a soda). If you want food, you have to pay for it. And what kind of food! Then, there is the entertainment: just as it seems to become a trend on the worst airlines, American Airlines forces you to use your own devices to be able to watch their programs. In their penny pinching minds, they automatically assume that everyone has a smart phone, or a tablet, or a computer. If you don't have any device on you, or your device is not compatible with their system (more on that later), you're out of luck. But the incredible part is, they don't even provide any electric plug or USB for you to plug in your devices! So, if all you have to watch movies onboard is your smartphone (which is already pitiful), and you need your phone battery fully charged for when you arrive at your final destination and need to call your friends, taxis, hotels, etc., again, you're out of luck. Now, let's talk about device compatibility with their onboard movie/TV system, which uses Flash Player. I did have a fully updated version of Flash Player on my computer, but their system kept saying it was not updated. After several attempts, since they were offering to download their own updated version of Flash Player, I decided to uninstall my version and replace it with theirs. Guess what? It still would not work. Their system would not recognize its own version of Flash Player on my machine! Unbelievable. I uninstalled and re-installed the app again, tried everything to get it to connect. Nothing worked. I spent the whole trip with no entertainment. Also, the cabin remained pitch black the whole time (you could barely see where you walked) which was very hard on your eyes when people constantly turned on their individual light or their computer screen. When we got to the luggage claim area at the airport, no indication anywhere of which carousel it was. When we finally found it, the previous plane had not even started their download, which made us wait for an extra hour. To top it off, I was carrying fragile items in a separate box. American Airlines made me pay an extra $200 (one way) because it was oversize. But the best part: they didn't put it with the oversize luggage (that are usually handled with a bit more care), they put it with the regular ones. Nothing was broken, but the whole experience really made me furious. The irony in all this is: AA is one of the only airline companies to wear the name: American. Aren't you ashamed, guys? You should be.

Miami to San Francisco. Absolutely awful! How is this airline still in business? I can't even believe how awful they are and expensive too. My flight was delayed 11 hours and there was no apology!! Just a deal with it attitude! No vouchers, no excuses, no apologies!! On top of that, a 5 hour flight offering a cold Turkey croissant for almost 10 dollars! Only choice! Plus a bad movie, their choice. Hated it! Never again!

Milano a Miami. Ho volato con la temuta Basic Economy, ed è andato tutto bene! Sapevo in cosa mi stavo cacciando - nessun bagaglio registrato, nessuna scelta del posto, imbarco per ultimo - quindi non ci sono state sorprese. Le mie aspettative erano basse e AA le ha generalmente superate. AA non ti darà una carta d'imbarco per i segmenti di volo finché non arrivi in ​​quell'aeroporto, il che è moderatamente fastidioso, ma questo è stato l'unico problema per me. C'era molto spazio nella cappelliera sui segmenti internazionali per la mia borsa. Avevo un posto centrale CLT-FCO ma avevo un posto corridoio MPX-MIA. Il cibo era discreto così come il servizio a bordo. IFE ottiene voti bassi perché non c'era alcun AVOD sul volo MXP-MIA di quasi 10 ore. Apparentemente le ristrutturazioni del 767-300 non sono andate così lontano per un assistente di volo. Inoltre, in Economy non ci sono porte di alimentazione

Dallas to Grand Island. Every flight on my vacation was delayed. Customer service was completely disrespectful. How am I supposed to be a satisfied customer when nothing goes the right way, this is not the first time this has happened, but it is now the last time it will ever happen. Delay after delay. They have no excuses. All staff are lazy and works at there own pace. People have lives and families outside the chaos of airports, we have made commitments to get from 1 place to the next, and this airline wants nothing more but to take our money. This is so pitiful. I am so angry and have had 2 anxiety attacks because I had no where to go when things canceled. I am a patriotic American. And it pushes me off that the company American Airlines cannot uphold what we are as a country.

Dallas to Santa Ana. Warning - do not travel economy in this airline. This means you will overpay, I ended up paying $ 500.00 for a flight I have made in JetBlue numerous times at a price of $97-$140. It guaranties that you will be seated in the last row and in the middle. Even when the plane is empty and they give others better seats free you will not be moved unless you pay extra. If you dare to request to be given another seat they reply â€œyou are group 9 economy.â€ When I requested an explanation they just said you don't get to change your seat. Someone booked this flight for me. Do not make this mistake.

New Orleans to Los Angeles. My flight was delayed 3 hours due to the unavailability of a flight crew. While waiting at the gate to board, the pilot announced that we did not have a flight crew available in New Orleans and that we would have to wait 3 hours for a crew to be flown in from Dallas. American offered no compensation for this major inconvenience. I wrote several letters but American just sent a form letter saying how sorry they were!! I am frequent flyer with AA and was offered no additional compensation - not even some extra miles.

Tampa to Barcelona via Philadelphia. Our flight attendants were more concerned about their off time than our comfort. They asked us to move seats - then we realized they wanted to claim the two rows all the way across in the back for their own lounge. They even made us go down to the middle of the plane to use the bathroom so they could have the one in the back. One was great the other four were awful.

Minneapolis to Charlotte. After experiencing a steady trend over the past several years in upward ticket prices and frequency of delay, I thought it was time to leave a review of American Airlines. I have recently experienced so many delays, resulting in missed connections, that I now find it preferable to fly to an airport 3 hours from my destination and drive the remainder. That is how unreliable airlines have become. Today, my flight has been delayed for two hours (so far), with a series of 3 increasing delay emails that began with a shorter predicted delay. After finding no information online about the reason for this delay (when airlines are usually eager to blame weather so everyone knows it's not their fault) I contacted customer service to inquire as to the nature of the delay. I was told "maintenance issues" after being on hold for over 10 minutes. I am writing this review in part to suggest a number of changes that AA could make to their service to dissuade negative reviews such as this: 1. If a delay is due to something that is the fault of the airline, and not the weather, state this honestly on flight status pages. 2. Maybe offer a voucher or other compensation when delays that are YOUR FAULT exceed two hours. Even something minorâ€”like a seat upgrade or free wifiâ€”would be better than nothing, and deter disgruntled passengers from boycotting your airline (which I am seriously considering at this point in time). 3. Change the "on hold" music to something with slightly better sound quality. Also, we do not need to be reminded of AA advertisements and "Please continue waiting" every 30 seconds. This is incredibly distracting and irritating when people are already irritated. 4. On your website's "Your Trip" section, clearly display the arriving aircraft's departure status, so that customers can click on the delayed flight and see where it's coming from and whether it's departed. This is an incredibly obvious thing that helps patrons gauge how long a delay is likely to last, or whether a cancellation is imminent. Other airlines already do this, but AA forces people to use better flight tracker services to check the status of the arriving aircraft. Unless some of these things change, I will not be using American Airlines any longer, and will recommend all of my friends, family and colleagues do the same.

Boston to Dallas Fort Worth. Ground employees extremely rude including check in and gate staff. American needs to work on service excellence. Will fly Jet Blue next time. They are known for great customer service. American has lost my business.

Austin to Montego Bay via DFW. Boarded the flight with no initial delay, 10 minutes after flight was scheduled to depart, the captain informed the flight via intercom that someone spotted a dent on the plane - maintenance allegedly told him that it would take about 15 minutes, then he would update us.
