What is the point of setting up days off and meetings if the airline cannot stick to the schedule they came up with? What is the point of paying extra for a specific seat if they are going to change your seat? What is the point of only having Wi Fi entertainment if the plane has no electric plugs to keep your device powered for 7 hours? I fly several times per year from Florida to the mid west and west coast. On this particular flight the flight attendant passed my row for snacks and drinks. Flight was delayed for departure and I was hungry. I asked her for a snack when she two rows back, rather then walk back two rows she said she would come back. After landing I asked her why she did not come back and why she passed my row - she said that she got busy and tried to get my attention 5 times. I asked my wife and friend sitting next to me if she tried to get my attention and they said no.

Orlando to Dublin via Philadelphia. Having read many Bad reviews from customers having flown American airlines , I wasn't looking forward to a 10 hour Dublin to Orlando flight with a return leg to look forward to 12 days later. We were two adults and 5 children between 10 and 15 years old. From check in staff In Dublin, to the flight crew, everything was above average. Many reviews complained about the seats, how uncomfortable they are and their pitch. This seems to be a problem with Boeing as the 4 Airbus planes we flew were comfortable and more than adequate. One issue we had which did leave a bad taste with all of us was the check In attendant in Orlando. We each had 23kg baggage allowance. On average we only had 10 kg each. We asked to check in one of the children's cabin baggage and were instructed that this would cost a further $100 as 7 albeit light bags had been checked in. We had to retrieve one of the bags to add her toiletries, as they would have been confiscated, necessitating 45 minutes of waiting for the bag to come back. The check in assistant was adimant and very cold in her customer service. It was an unfortunate experience but the other staff were very good.

Philadelphia to Dallas Ft Worth. My original flight was from Philly (departure time 6:05am) to (O'Hare departure 8:10am) then to DFW (arrival at 10:36am). First, I got held up in Philadelphia for almost 3 hours because of the weather. Which, it wasn't even raining out yet but they weren't sure about the weather. Ok. Which in return missed my flight from O'Hare to DFW. I arrived in O'Hare 10:45am. I got another flight departure 1:00pm. Ok. Its 12:30, now the flight is delayed till 1:37. Ok. Its 1:15, flight is now delayed till 4:05! So again, it's 2:30 now my flight gets cancelled. Now there's no flights to DFW until tomorrow morning!! Not going to work for me. So now I have to fly to Raleigh-Durham, NC. To DFW arrival time 9:05. Worst airline imaginable! I will never fly American airlines again nor recommend it to anyone. Awful customer service skills also.

San Francisco to Ithaca via Philadelphia. Awful from start to finish. Cramped over stuffed planes and the whole experience screamed â€œhow can we make the most money regardless of customer quality?â€. My flight was canceled in PHL. They will not reach out to you for a refund so I called customer service and spoke to the rudest woman who was about to explode with anger at any moment. As if it was my fault. She was rageful and just terrible at making me feel like a valued customer. Who knows if I'll actually get the refund for my cancelled flight (since it's such an inconvenience to AA airlines). Never ever again. Just the worst.

Chicago to Denver. My family and I are trying to get home to Colorado. Me, my brother and my sister and our friend have been put on standby four times, the people at this airline are not much help, they have bad attitudes, are lazy, and they didn't even bother to ask other people to give up their seats or to check the airplane to see if it was full. I am very mad at this airline and right now you have four very unhappy customers. This airline is not worth flying with and i will rate this 1 out of 5 stars.

Norfolk to Montreal via Philadelphia. My flight for 8 AM from Norfolk to Montreal was cancelled due to the crew not being available, it was chaotic at the airport. I waited two whole hours in line with Zero customer care or attention. Finally I was told that the only flight would take me to Montreal is in the afternoon and then I would arrive at 11

Orlando to Charlotte. First off, our plane got canceled the night before while other airlines just delayed until later into the night. Then, we got charged twice for baggage and the employees were rude. Lady said we had to wait until our whole family was with us. When we were together I got in line and she said I had to wait until she let me in line and I said i was here the whole time and my family is here and she kicked my bag out of the way and put someone in front of me. Then we were told to go to another line to get refunded our baggage and when we got there, they told us to call a number. Ridiculous how you can't get in person customer service and everything is by phone number.

New York to St Louis. American Airlines is one of the worst airlines I have traveled. Every time they charged Carry on fee of $50.00 at the gate, cancelling flights and called the reason beyond their control. Our flight taxied on runway for 20 minutes before taking off and they cancelled the flight, because plane didn't have enough fuel for the journey. Is this a good reason? We had to stay overnight in NY at our own expense and spend more the $300.00 not including the taxi fare to and from the Hotel. This is not the first time it has happened in our previous trip also. They overbook the flight and then bump-off people because of some silly reason.

Tampa to El Salvador via Miami. American Airlines has the worst service. They cancelled my trip 3 times. They overbooked the next available flight so they asked us all to check in our carry ons. They didn't care about me needing my suitcases to retrieve my medication. They told me they were just not giving it because it would cause too much trouble.

Ciudad de México a Charlotte. Era la primera vez que viajaba con American Airlines y, para ser sincero, me decepcionó mucho. La duración de mi vuelo fue de aproximadamente 3 h 30 min a 4 h. ¿Y qué nos sirvieron de comer? Dos galletas y una bolsa de pretzels. Sin televisión y wifi terrible. Siempre he volado en Delta y es mucho mejor. No creas que pronto volaré en AA.

Jacksonville to Phoenix via Dallas Fort Worth. This was the worst flight experience I ever had. Our flight was delayed an hour and a half to Dallas and made us miss our connector. They put us up in a hotel to get us to Phoenix the next morning, but that flight was delayed an hour as well. They also changed the gate on us to a completely different terminal. We had to sit on the plane for half an hour before departing while technical difficulties were fixed. This interfered with our scheduled plans with friends, and we almost missed a wedding in Payson, AZ. We had to cancel our hotel and car reservations and make new ones, and if you are basic economy you don't even get a snack. I will never be flying American again.

Baltimore to Tallahassee via Miami. Flight from BWI was for scheduled for 4:55 got delayed until 9. We didn't get to Miami until 1am. When here the airline gave us a hotel and said it was only 15 min away. We get to the shuttle and ask if they go to the hotel American gave us. And he laughed and said it was 35 min away. So we tried to find a shuttle that could take us but the next one came 1 and a half hours later. So we had to sleep in Miami Airport. Which is the biggest garbage can of a airport that I've been to we got here and trash was laying everywhere. Next our flight from Miami to Tallahassee was scheduled for 10:30 but got canceled. So we're waiting again. And fingers crossed the flight will come at 2 but seeing how frequently flights get delayed and canceled I'm extremely doubtful about taking off at 2.

Dallas to New Orleans. I fly 2 to 3 times a month. American Airlines is one of the worst airlines to take. If you want bad service, delayed flights and more gate switching at the last second then take this airline. I avoid their airline like the plague. You would think being around as long as they have they would figure it out. Last leg with them was delayed by an hour because they didn't have enough flight attendants. Really! Get your act together or sellout to an entity that knows what they are doing and by no means do you deserve a main hub at Dallas. You deserve one in Siberia.

New York JFK to Orlando via Charlotte. My experience was by no means good but not bad. The flight to Charlotte left at a ridiculous time of 5am, Tsa screening didn't open until 4 am (we arrived at 2am). Even worse the ground crew had terrible attitude problems, there was one agent who arrived, checked in 1 passenger then went home. But apart from that, the flight attendants were lovely people who knew great service. The ground crew in Charlotte seemed to be quite pleasant as well.

Charlotte to Miami. Sat on tarmac for 45 minutes pilot said "Miami is open 24 hours so we are going to take our time." Flight before this one (the flight I'm reviewing was a connecting flight) was also delayed. Flight attendants kept bumping into my seat as they would pass by. $25 checked bag fee which is really stupid considering their competitors offer 1 if not sometimes two free checked bags.

Paris CDG à New York. Un peu "geek des compagnies aériennes", j'ai utilisé un site Web pratique pour découvrir que notre B767 avait 23,7 ans. En voyage d'affaires international, j'espérais que l'avion serait modernisé avec des équipements modernes. Tout d'abord, l'Admirals Club à CDG est magnifique - nourriture ... alcool, espace de travail, espaces de détente

Charlotte to Chattanooga. My flight was cancelled both ways. We missed a connecting flight in Charlotte even though we arrived 10 minutes before take off. Airline staff would not let us board because they already gave our seats away. Paid for seat upgrade and ended up sitting in back of the plane and not sitting with my family. I spoke to several staff and no one seemed to care. Horrible!

Philadelphia to Los Angeles. We were boarded on the plane and sat on the plane for an hour and a half before take off because the line was so backed up and this was only for American airline flights as we were leaving there were still 11 planes behind us. After a flight across the US we come to baggage claim to find out more than half of the bags on that flight were placed on another plane that will arrive 2 hours later. I'm writing this review as I'm sitting on the floor of the airport with this extra time. Thanks American airlines for three hours I'll never get back.

London to Norfolk via New York. Flight canceled on way to UK (maintenance), flight canceled on return (JFK to ORF). Previously 6 out of my last 10 flights have been canceled and significant delays. They are just shameless and I am now shifting to United Airlines. I don't think fare paying passengers will be treated with some respect and any level of customer care until the regulatory authorities/Government take action to implement a code of conduct that protects the passengers.

Dallas to Los Angeles. Late again! Pilot emphasized 3 x during flight how we would arrive 4 minutes ahead of schedule. Once at LAX, sat on plane over 45 minutes making us over 25 minutes late. Pilot had no explanation except that AA plane at our gate couldn't move due to minor mechanical problem and paperwork. Couldn't find another gate at LAX. Same old AA incompetence.

Chattanooga to Washington via Charlotte. My 8:00 pm flight got cancelled on Friday. Rebooked for 5:40 am Saturday and when I woke up at 3:00 am to get ready to head to the airport I had a notification on my phone saying flight got cancelled again and rebooked for later. This has ruined my trip as I have to keep making my personal schedule changes accordingly. This is not the first time this has happened to me. I plan to make this rebooked flight my last AA flight. I am currently on the phone on hold for past 1hr:37 min. Do you want to be in my place? If no, don't fly AA.

Albuquerque to Miami via Dallas. More than disturbed with the attitude of the AA staff at Albuquerque this morning. Walked up to the check in clerk this morning and was met with some of the worst attitude I have dealt with traveling (and I travel a lot). She spent more time trying to lecture me like a child than trying to get me on my flight, after causing me to miss the flight she finished her lecture with "you and your handicap brother will be lucky to travel together being that your whole trip is now stand by, good luck). So I asked to chat with the supervisor who I guess was at the gate, so we proceeded to the gate, we arrived at the gate still with plenty of time to board the plane that we had already been kicked off because the agent was too lazy to check and rush one bag to the plane. As I arrived at the gate I asked for supervisor and when she appeared I asked are you a manager, her response was "yes I dont have much time what do you want?" Taken back once again by the courteous and helpful nature of the now management I said "would you like to wait to chat with me until you have more time?" She then peered at me with a cold glare and asked me to continue. I explained the attitude I encountered at the front counter she showed no element of caring and proceeded to tell me if I'm not 1.5 hours early there is no guarantee the staff at AA will do their job and get you on the flight. Other passengers were pervy to my conversation and began to share their stories of rude counter staff here today too. As a seasoned traveler I've seen every aspect of good and bad customer service is this is terrible. Many airlines will bend over backwards to get you on you flights knowing that sometimes we (customers) run a little behind and sometimes you (airlines) run behind and the end goal is transported happy customers. The attitude of the AA staff today was more like your late, here is a unnecessary lecture about being early now your screwed good luck. Lots of options of airlines and AA is slipping.
Phoenix to Honolulu. The worst trip ever. Every American airlines flight had some type of mechanical issue. 3 times in less than 24 hours causing me to miss my son's birthday.

Philadelphia to Orlando. Worst trip in my 50 years of flying experience. Long delay on flight out for weather, not airlines fault. Then over 2.5 hour delay return trip for repair that was theoretically done before pulling from tarmac. Returned, deplaned and sat with few updates or alternatives. Paid over $200 for upgrades and when we asked for my wife and I to sit together, denied. Because we had booked separately and could only upgrade her to first class willing to give up first class no refund to sit together. Didn't even try to help us, just said can't be done. Ended up asking person next to me if they wanted first class and let them sit in wife's spot so we could fly together.

Philadelphia to Manchester. This airline continues to disappoint. Delayed, delayed, delayed. Why is it they can never get anyone out on time. I have airline points but will be giving them up as I will never fly this airline again, even a free flight is not worth this aggravation. Don't apply for their credit card either as there really are no advantages to having one. No priority boarding, no free upgrades, they just suck!!

Mazatlan to Dallas Ft Worth. Horrible service at Mazatlan international airport, they try to charge you for carry on luggage including threatening you that you are not going on the flight and you are going to miss your flight if you do not give them what they ask. This airline should go out of business for the tactic they use to force you to pay for carry on, never again I would use American Airlines.

Buffalo to Philadelphia was fine. Not comfortable, but adequate. However, the connecting flight from Philadelphia to BWI was first delayed multiple times, and finally (an hour and a half later) cancelled altogether. According to the boarding desk personal, flights were being cancelled due to "congestion." Connecting flight was supposed to depart at 8:05 am, but due to all flights to BWI by American out of Philadelphia that day, the first available flight out was at 5:55 pm, which meant my afternoon meeting in Washington was impossible. Apparently Philadelphia to Baltimore was not the only flight cancelled out of Philadelphia that day

Tokio Narita naar Los Angeles. Eerste ervaring met deze luchtvaartmaatschappij op een internationale route. Beide vluchten op tijd. Vliegtuigen en toiletten schoon. Personeel was zeer professioneel en proactief op beide reizen. Tal van entertainment. Het eten zal Emirates niet snel een run voor zijn geld opleveren, maar soms is gewoon een warme, eenvoudige maaltijd lekker. Wifi gaat van goed naar langzaam naar goed - misschien het geld niet waard. Zou ze zeker opnieuw kiezen. Is dit echt dezelfde luchtvaartmaatschappij die al deze negatieve beoordelingen lijkt te krijgen?

上海經達拉斯沃斯堡飛往西棕櫚灘。根據 AA 的配置和操作，波音 787 是一個飛行酷刑室。座位又硬又窄。過道非常狹窄，無法通行，而且可能不安全。服務充其量只是敷衍。不惜一切代價避免！乘坐轉機航班、舊飛機、火車、公共汽車，但避開這架飛機，至少在這家航空公司。波音 787 是一架潛在的偉大飛機，但通過擠壓座位來榨取每一分利潤，AA 已經毀了它。作為背景，我是一名前飛行員，中等身材，乘坐 AA 航班超過 150 萬英里，我從未如此討厭飛行。哦，對了，大概100 人只有3 個可用的盥洗室，如果你能跳過過道，甚至把頭跨過過道的話，而且這趟航班上80% 都是亞洲人，所以我們不是在談論芝加哥熊隊的人數！

Wichita to Lexington via Chicago. First flight delayed 1 hour 20 min causing me to miss my connection. My second flight had not left yet but they closed boarding as I got to the gate. Leaving me stuck at the airport for 7 hours until next the available flight. The second flight was delayed over 30 min. The first delay caused me to have incur unplanned and unnecessary rental car fees as I missed my ride at my final destination. After seeing all the other flights that were delayed today with American Airlines I will be choosing a different airline from now on, even if costs a little more.

New York JFK to Baltimore Washington. We booked two flights with them, round trip and both connecting, and both times in separate months, the flights were cancelled due to maintenance. Same airline, same issue, and has interfered with connecting flights. We were supposed to return home in the late morning, it was delayed by an hour, then cancelled when we were supposed to start boarding. What's our comp? $24 in meal vouchers, a taxi to a different airport, and not much else. I will never fly this airline again, and since I have no preference for airlines, that's saying something. What's wrong with your planes that they're always down for maintenance?

New York to Columbia via Chicago. This is the worst experience I've ever had flying. American airlines is a nightmare. Cancelled their flight leaving me stranded at the airport and playing redirection games while I sought for assistance. No customer empathy. Even in the dream or nightmare would never fly American airlines again.

Orlando to New York. After reading reviews, I was very surprised how good the flight was. Left on time, good food and good service. Seats were good, only 4 rows of 2. Plane left on time and arrived on time. No issues whatsoever.

Chicago to Dayton. Flight took off on time. After 30 minutes of odd flying, pilot announces cabin pressure was not being maintained. Flight was diverted to Chicago. After landing it was announced that the cargo door was not properly closed. They closed the cargo door and maintenance performed pressure check and we boarded the flight again, three hours later. I've contacted American Airlines several times to find our how they can miss a cargo door not being sealed prior to take off. The flight crew was blaming the Chicago ground crew. This concerns me regarding safety for future flights. American Airlines has been dismissive and has responded that they simply don't have that information and there is no one that they can direct me to for answers. Pathetic. Flight attendants were very pleasant, otherwise.

San Diego to Phoenix. Flight from PHX was two hours late. Then the return flight was also two hours late. The app said â€œon timeâ€ until the very last minute so there was no way to salvage any of the time. On the day of the flight I got a seating change via the app. Changed us to seats in different rows. Tried to call about it, but the automated system said 1.5 hour wait. Turns out the original seat assignments I got were in a non existent row. These people are a bunch of screw ups. It used to be a good airline, but it sure isn't anymore.

Melbourne Fl to Dayton via Charlotte. Our flight was scheduled at 8:45 and I received an email this morning at 6:00 that it was delayed and we will miss our connection flight. We knew at the airport that this flight has been delayed for the last 5 consecutive days. If I would have known this in advanced I will schedule my flight for a day early. I considered this an abuse of power by the airline.

Chicago to Los Angeles. The worst customer service ever given! The staff isn't very polite they're very curt with you, you ask for a manager or person in charge they won't get you one they say they're not available. From a delayed 4hr flight that started in France not allowing enough time for the 4hr layover we originally had in Chicago they rescheduled us on united giving us 90 minute layover which we missed because they made us go get our bags go through TSA and then recheck our bags etc.. they ended up putting us on another flight that was canceled long story short after 36 hrs at Chicago O'Hare trying to get home American Airlines did nothing to help us we called customer service we asked for a person in charge (non available), not until we had to get loud with them that they finally got us on stand by again for like the 7th time that we were able to get on a flight! We spend $300 on a hotel stay that wasn't planned and to top it off American Airlines sent our luggage with United we had no clothes and our luggage was at LAX!

Syracuse to Cancun via Charlotte. Vacation ruined, 2nd time last year vacation to Jamaica ruined (lost 1 day flight cancelled), this year lost the bag came after 1 day. On our way back flight delayed, 1 more day in transit! Wife flew from JFK to Syracuse last year lost the bag, will never fly AA any more. I do not care about the entertainment, staff kindness, food, wifi, I am talking about basic stuff. Flights for the most part delayed, cancelled etc, bags expectedly messed up, delayed,lost. I cannot remember a trip without issues.

Minneapolis to Philadelphia. Do not fly this airline! When booking it may seem cheaper but they nickel and dime you for every little thing which cost you more in the long run. My son had a bicycle that could only fit in an oversized bag. When we went to check in they charged us $150 extra because there was a bike inside the bag. Not reading word for word the baggage policy, as most passengers don't, we were unaware bikes were not allowed unless in a box. The manager and the baggage check in person accused us of Fraud and stealing from the airline. We explained it was not stealing No fraud because we were unaware of of the policy. Nonetheless they both continued harassing us and would not make any accommodations even though my wife is a frequent business flyer on their airline. They charged us $150 extra. Never flying this Airline again.

Miami to Tampa. bWorst experience of my life flying ever! I fly a ton for work and I have never ever been treated so poorly. My husband and I have the American Airlines card and have access to their lounge which we pay $400 for annually. The treatment from the staff of the Miami airport tonight is outrageous. We will be canceling and never flying with them again. I understand delays are out of their control but we sat on and unconditioned plane for an hour just to then sit at the airport with literally no update on our constantly delayed flight for hours. To say I'm outraged and disappointed is a major understatement. This has ruined our entire vacation. I can't believe I'm even paying for this flight they call service. Please, never fly American. I know we won't be ever again.

Miami to Laguardia. My flight was scheduled for 8:32pm. When we get on the plane, we were told shortly after that there was going to be a delay, which was understandable due to the weather in NY. Soon later, they made everyone get off of the plane because it was too hot on the plane and the air conditioner wasn't effective, and they ran out of drinking water. We get off of the plane and wait for an update. No accurate update was given. We were simply told that the weather was bad and that now our Captain can't fky because he's over his time. They called several more captains and it was too late for them all to fly. They finally found a captain that Can fly. We get back in the plane, which was crammed. We waited almost an hour. I asked the flight attendant what was going on and what time we were taking off. She said she did not know. I asked for water because it was very hot and was told they ran out still. So we were going to be on a 3 hour flight with no water. Soon later, we all get texts that our flight was cancelled. We asked the flight attendant and they had no information. Finally we were told by the captian that it was cancelled. It was past 12am at this point. It took forever for them to re-in-board the plane. We finally get off and get directed to the reservation area by an AA employee by the name of Ana.Short Spanish looking lady.With no patience, she very rudely screams at us while swinging her finger in our face, to get in a single file line and â€œdon't even think about cuttingâ€.It's not like she made that comment before and people ignored her. She has an attitude right away.I was very annoyed because we have been on and off that plane several times for hours and have also waited a very long time, just for the flight to be cancelled at 12 in the morning.Then take a shuttle to an airport at 2 in the morning with a rescheduled flight at 8am. Lost out on an entire day of pay because of this airline. I would have been less upset if the staff wasn't so rude and if they acted like they cared that we were bounced around for hours. Everything was unorganized and unprofessional.

Las Vegas to Miami. Today they made passengers from the Vegas red eye into Miami, wait 1.5 hours for bags at 5am. When I complain at the counter the clerk told me that nothing could be done and the supervisor was in a call and would not pay attention to this service to the passengers. There was no storm. Clerks at the bag counters were beyond careless. Shame on you American Airlines for treating passengers like this.

Philadelphia to Charlotte. Traveling with an infant and family. Called and paid an additional 25.00 per head to ensure we got seating assignments together since we had an infant. Agent assured us seats were together. Got to airport, no seat assignment, and was informed there was nothing they could do. Gate agent was rude and a great representation of the Company and how they treat their customers.

Norfolk to St Louis. I had the most unpleasant experience on your airline July 4th weekend. I arrived at Norfolk International Airport shortly after 10am for a flight that was going to St Louis, Missouri. The flight was delayed due to weather conditions in Charlotte

Αθήνα προς Μαϊάμι. Απλώς γράφω αυτήν την κριτική για να επαινέσω έναν μεμονωμένο εργαζόμενο της American Airline στο αεροδρόμιο ATL. Άργησα πολύ για την πτήση μου και παρόλο που το γραφείο είχε ήδη κλείσει για 45 λεπτά και η ζώνη αποσκευών είχε σβήσει, με βοήθησε να βγάλω έναν τόνο και εκτύπωσε τα έγγραφα που χρειαζόμουν πιο γρήγορα από ό,τι μπορούσα. Φρόντισε επίσης τις αποσκευές μου και ήταν στην πύλη μου για να με διαβεβαιώσει για αυτό πριν επιβιβαστώ στο αεροπλάνο. Κάνω πολλά ταξίδια και δεν είχα τόσο μεγάλη βοήθεια!

Philadelphia to Atlanta. Absolutely horrible. Not only was my flight delayed by 4 hrs than its original departure time of 5:30, but they also left the lights on the airplane the entire ride from 9:30 to 11:30 while most passengers wanted to sleep, this prohibited a lot of passengers including myself from sleeping. The only snack your offered are pretzels. I also didn't get my bag about 12 to 12:30. The constant delays were unreal. I didn't get settled at home until 1:30 in the morning, which caused problems for me the next day. Then when I opened my luggage the next day it was clear that my luggage was handled extremely poorly. I wrapped a glass picture frame in clothes so it wouldn't get damaged in flight as I've done before with delta without a fragile sticker being placed on it and with delta it would always be fine, when I opened my bag the frame was shattered and the broken glass had ruined my picture. There was also a 10min delay getting off of the plane. Then when I went to the train to go to baggage claim, the train was very slow, not just arriving to pick us up at the gate, but moving to baggage claim. I'd sooner fly on any other airline before ever flying American airlines ever again! Not to mention the train and airport was cold as hell, colder than normal.

Portland to Charleston via Charlotte. We had a horrible experience. Our connecting flight was cancelled, when I went to the counter I was told my flight would be the next day. I'm three hours from my destination but because of the computer glitch they had days prior there were no rental cars. Anywhere. I asked to be put on a sooner flight and was given the flight at noon. 5 delays and 4 gate changes later we took off at 4 pm. I had to ask for a meal voucher for my child since we were at the airport for 12hrs. We were finally given one for lunch for 24.00 with the airport food costs that wawas enough for him to get a burger meal and me a drink. I will never fly American again. Those poor people working there have no power to give customer service for c.

Prague to Akron via Philadelphia.I flew on American Airlines twice. Once on the way to Europe in early June 2018, and once on the way back to the United States in mid-July 2018. On the way to Europe, my flights were delayed several times and I was 12 hours past my arrival time. On the way back, my flights were delayed and rebooked a total of six times. I eventually made it to Philadelphia at midnight (14 hours later than expected) and they gave me a hotel voucher where I could stay until 1pm the next day when my flight left for home. After waiting 40 minutes for the shuttle that never came, I ubered to the hotel. The hotel said American Airlines had met their quota and that they had actually sold all their rooms. I tried calling the corporate number and they said there was nothing they could do from there. I tried to call the airport and they redirected back to corporate. So I found the shuttle back to the airport where I was told that they didn't have any more vouchers but if I keep my receipts they should reimburse me. Instead, I called reservations and demanded an earlier flight, which they somehow found. They dropped the ball on almost every aspect of this trip and I will never fly with them again.

Boston to New Orleans via Charlotte. Our first flight was delayed by 8hours 26minutes since they had to do maintenance on the plane for 3-4 hours. After the maintenance, they noticed that they are missing one flight attendant, and we had to wait for him to arrive for over 4 hours. We were told that we would get a hotel at Charlotte, where our connecting flight would leave and were we would have to wait for several hours (original change time was 2 hours, now 6.5 hours). When we arrived, we were met by very rude loud American Airlines staff that were willing to do nothing about the matter or help us in anyway. Hotels were booked, but nonetheless they did not offer food or anything in compensation. Or even an apology (like it was our fault). To sumarize: if you want very bad unhelpful and rude service, delayed flights with sleeping on airports and lies atop of lies how "they will handle it". Fly with American Airlines. I certainly will never again.

Roswell to Louisville via Dallas. Excuse after excuse with delayed flights. Started off with delayed aircraft then told it was a maintenance issue and now with the flight leaving supposedly leaving two hours after it's original departure time we're being told we are waiting on a crew! Where was the crew that was supposed to be on the original flight? There's no excuse for this, send someone from management to explain the issue not hide behind your desk and let your poor gate agents catch the brunt of people's frustrations. Only using American because I booked through employer website, won't use personal funds to fly this airline. Delayed my flight last week for an hour waiting on a wheel chair to be brought to remove a patient from the arriving aircraft. Poor service!

Ft Walton to Dallas Ft Worth. American Airlines is by far one of the worst airlines I have flown with. I have been traveling a lot for work lately and have been on over 4 flights in the past week with them. Each flight has been delayed, their employees do nothing to inform their guest of the delay or what is going on. American Airlines used to be very organized and customer friendly, however, after my past few experience I will never book a flight through them again.

Honolulu to Phoenix. Trying to return home after honeymoon plane was delayed on runway for 3 hours and then finally at 1.30am deboarded plane just to wait another 2-3 hours for hotel voucher which serves no purpose since our flight which we had to change ourselves to Delta was leaving at 11am. My wife and I have been up for over 24 hours and still have another 25 before returning home. The only kind person was the morning ticketing agent who at least gave us a food voucher. Customer service was non-existent and my family and myself will never fly American Airlines again! Thank you for making my honeymoon unforgettable!

Charlotte to Dallas. Worst airline! I fly weekly for work and I have to unfortunately use American Airlines because of my projects budget. Every time I Fly with American, my flight is always delayed! How inconvenient and annoying can this airline be? Then when you call for customer service they are so rude and inconsiderate! I've had flights that were connecting and I've had to run for my life to catch it because my flight was delayed for 2 hours. This airline always makes it a point to disappoint me. The best airline thus far is Southwest and Delta.

Tampa to Maui via Phoenix. Over the past three years I've noticed a massive downgrade in American airline aircraft. As a result of me working in Maui my days of travel always involve long flights. Since of lately American Airlines has repeatedly shown poor customer service as well outdated aircrafts taking away from the customer experience. This is my sixth flight in a row either coming into or departing from Maui that my 7+ hour flight lacks charging stations or entertaining screens. Due it's lack of amenities, customer care and high prices, has caused me to reconsider my loyalty to this airline. For such expensive and long flights to Hawaii you would think that American would offer its newest aircrafts not oldest.

Amarillo to Destin. Seriously the worst airline ever. This is one of many awful experiences with them and it keeps getting worse. After making me more that 6 hours late (which i can understand for weather), they fail to get my luggage on the airplane. Between all of the delays they had plenty of time to switch my luggage so I do not understand why my stuff is missing. Minus a select few, most of the service is terrible.

Washington to Miami . The gate attendant at Washington was extremely rude and unprofessional. After we waited 30 minutes on the late plane, the gate attendant rushed us all on the plane and stopped me to insist that I must check my bags on an empty flight. I had 1 suitcase, 1 duffel bag, 1 small fannie pack on my waist and a black plastic food bag that I purchased at the airport. The attendant's 1st option with handling me was to call security, no compassion or customer service or people skills. She wouldn't explain to me the policy or other alternatives. My flight experience was ruined. I felt alone and depleted. The other gate attendant that came minutes later in full uniform couldn't believe the way the 1st gate attendant was treating me. special shout-out to Miami American Airlines baggage claim staff. They were the total opposite as they listened to my situation and handled the issue effortlessly with great customer service! They turned my day all the way around. They should train the DCA staff!

Miami to new York JFK. Boarded the plane and pulled away from gate only to find out twenty minutes in that we needed air pressure and a boost and we waited 3 hours with no air in 100 degree weather in Miami just for mechanics to come fix the problem that they said was no big deal. Then we had to wait about an extra hour for a push car to come push the plane and only the crew shows up without the starter car! Had to wait another half hour for them to find the car . And all this we were only told 2.5 hours in that we may leave the plane but the kicker is they were not giving back luggage and were putting whoever wanted to leave on standby to wait whenever they decide to give you another flight. They said it could be tonight tomorrow or next week. How convenient. Who is going to go anywhere without their luggage? Basically didn't make sense for anyone to leave so we had no choice. On top of all that the flight attendants were the laziest I ever met. I am 6 months pregnant with an 8 month old baby. We were both sweating and overheated. My baby couldn't even eat it was so hot for her and I asked one for water about an hour in and she pointed to her metal cabinet draws where the water is. Was I supposed to get it myself ? Who knows. I had to start crying to finally get water. Then they said that maybe they should start giving out some water. Maybe? Is that a joke. People are dehydrating. When my husband asked one for iced water she just stared at him with a blank face she only got it once he yelled and then she got mad he yelled ! They only started giving out water about two hours in and had to ration it because they ran out. People had connecting flights in JFK that they missed and you would think they gate manager would help them reschedule or provide them with a compensation but no. Our only compensation was a movie and 1 pack of cookies. I could go on and on. So unprofessional so lazy so incompetent. They should be out of business and should be ashamed of themselves

Denver to Dallas Ft Worth. The worst experience of my life. The staff is rude , there is no desire to ensure that you get home quickly, and they nickel and dime you more than Spirit. I was on a standby flight which I still paid 100 bucks for and because I was D3, literally anyone who is D1 or D2 can cut in front of you at any time. I got to the airport for a 5am flight at 2:30am, and was bumped off the next 7 flights. I had to take a vacation day from work because I couldn't get back in time. There was no communication and they couldn't ensure that I get back because â€œthat's just the standby game.â€ Well, if I am still a paying customer, and if I've been sitting here for 14 hours then I should be treated as such. After the 5th missed flight, I finally folded and bought a ticket myself ($65) so I could get home. Since I bought this ticket the morning of, I was on boarding group 9. This means that you're only allowed one personal item which was never conveyed to me. Even though my bag was carry-on size, I had to pay $50 for them to check my bag as I was boarding because I was in group 9 and that's not allowed apparently, and they were out of room in the overhead storage bins since THEY oversold the flight. None of which, by the way was my fault. Use another airline.

Dallas to Hong Kong. Seated in Main Cabin Extra. Plenty of leg room to endure the 15 hour + journey in both directions. Only 2 options for dinner (cod and pork). Former was surprisingly flavorful and tasty. Mid flight snack was stromboli and salted caramel gelato. Breakfast eggs/hash browns. Typical airline food. Nothing out of the extra-ordinary. Service was nothing more than necessary. Flight attendants appear to be more concerned about getting service over with. Entertainment choices were plentiful. I have flown long haul with Emirates and American Airlines' service pales compared to the former.

San Diego to Dallas. So disappointed with this airline. There was a 5 hour delay, with no announcement no email no nothing. They just have us sitting out here blinking. Flight was supposed to be super early morning and yet we are still here hours and hours later. We had to Google the flight ourselves to find out why we were not leaving as scheduled. No one said anything. Customer service phone number was not helpful either. Very frustrated and disappointed with the lack of communication, not to mention how those screws up my work plans for tomorrow!!

Philadelphia to Miami. In the last 2 years more and more frequently the service is getting worse. Today we are waiting on board more than hours for catering. Wait more than a 1 day and American airlines canceled the trip. We almost lost the trip to Aruba. Preview I traveled to Cuba and they offered a Voucher for 2000 whoever is canceling the trip The service is getting worse and worse No respectful at all.

Denver to Gatwick via Orlando. Worst experience, will not do it again. I was flying unaccompanied with a toddler on this trip. I intentionally booked flights that had a couple layovers thinking it would give the baby the opportunity to get out and about to do something else on a long journey. These layovers is where all the trouble started. Flew from Denver to North Carolina and made the connection without a hitch. Then from North Carolina to Orlando before heading to London. My flight coming into Orlando arrived late. By the time I was able to de-board the plane my connection was boarding in another terminal, completely on the other side of the airport where I had to leave and re-enter security to get there. Since I was carrying a 30+ lb. Toddler and a 15+ lb carseat I tried to ask for help to get where I needed to go quickly. The gate agents response (at every stop) was it's faster just to do it yourself. So nowI sprint across all of the Orlando airport get to security only to find the boarding passes they sent me for my British Airways connection don't work. Security tells me I have to go to the ticket counter to get new passes .my flight is boarding as we speak. I run to the ticket counter, loaded down with baby & her stuff to find no one at the counter. Talk to the American Airlines representative (flight is booked as american airlines, operated as british airways) to be informed they can't do anything they will have to see if there is someone around for British Airways. Find someone, get my boarding pass, make it through security get on the plane with 3 minutes to spare. Coming back was worse. Flight out of Florida was delayed 2 hours causing me to miss my connection. After flying 9 hours with a toddler, going through customs in and out of security and hauling around all the baby gear they wanted to put me on a connecting flight to get home the following moring! Finally found 1 gate agent who sympathized and managed to get me the last 2 seats on the last flight that night. However

Chicago to New York. After all the hassle with another airline flights being cancelled I managed to book myself on AA an flight from ORD to NWR. It was a ripoff but had no other alternative and paid 487 USD for a one way ticket. As if the drama of this particular night didn't want to end, AA has added to the spice by delaying the 9.50pm until 11:50pm then till 12:30am. After we boarded the plane and ready to take off I saw the crew running around and suddenly they announced that this aircraft can't fly tonight because it is scheduled for maintenance in the morning. Then we had to leave the plane and wait for a new aircraft. Finally there was a new plane came and we took off at 2:30am instead of 9:50pm the previous night. Finally landed in NYC at 5:30am totally exhausted and had to run for my important meeting at 8:30am. This was just a disaster. The plane was very old and dirty.

Cancun to Montreal via Philadelphia. Extremely bad experience. First, the flight from Philadelphia got delayed 15 minutes, to only get delayed another 30 later on. The flight attendants were extremely rude, actually only one of them, he was shouting commands at us while boarding the plane. The company does not provide inflight meals even though the number of hours ant time of the day would require so. This is by far the worst flight experience I had so far. Avoid this company!

Da Roma a Detroit via Filadelfia. Ho avuto la mia parte di brutte esperienze di viaggio e spesso mi sono costretto a scrivere brutte recensioni, quindi è giusto che quando ho un'esperienza davvero fantastica scrivo anche una recensione appropriata. Situazione classica: il nostro volo da Roma a Filadelfia (AA 719) è stato ritardato di circa due ore, il che ci ha fatto perdere il nostro volo in coincidenza (con Dreaded Delta) da Filadelfia alla nostra casa a Detroit. Molto raramente questo risultato va a favore dei viaggiatori. Un ottimo servizio clienti non nasce dalla perfezione

Miami to San Francisco. Ridiculous! It's 1 am and still at the airport in Miami! My flight to San Francisco was supposed to depart at 7:50 pm and the crew had us waiting for 2 hours in the plane while fixing Documents. The problem is that they didn't keep us informed as to what was happening. Then we got sent to another aircraft because apparently the one we were originally didn't pass the test when it should've been tested beforehand. While we are waiting on the second flight after 4 hours of waiting then the crew disappears and we have not pilot. I completely understand that incidents happen if it's a weather condition, or even if there is something wrong with the aircraft. But, the fact that they staff kept lying to all passengers is not professional! My time is very valuable. Again very unprofessional from the company staff to not be transparent with the passengers.

Chicago to Jamaica via Charlotte. This airline is a joke. I'm not sure when they last took off on time. We flew from Chicago heading to Charlotte and after half an hour in the air the captain had to land back to Chicago due to a smell coming out of the AC. This caused connecting flights to be missed and took us more than 6 hours to catch a flight to Jamaica. On the way back, we had a 2 hour delay at Charlotte pushing the take off time to 1am without notifying customers that check points at CLT closes at 9:45pm. Yes, if your flight is late at night you have to check in before 9:45pm or otherwise you can't make it to the gate. We had to spend the night at a nearby hotel to catch the earliest flight which was also delayed after boarding due to maintenance. Worst experience ever.

Chicago to Newark. Over 5 hour delay, poor communication, rude staff with apparently lack of information. Puppets we call them. Better equip and train your staff to communication and provide credible information to paying customers.

Miami to Houston. I find it extremely unprofessional for an airline company to not be able to explain why a flight was delayed three different times. When asked at the front desk to speak to a representative or manager, the employees of American airlines gave extremely rude, non-hospital answers. If a passenger books a flight for hundreds of dollars to a destination, they should have the right to know exactly why a flight was delayed without attitude from American Airlines crew. It is the responsibility of the airline to provide factual answers to the customer who is spending several hundreds of dollars. If I could give this airline a -10 I would.

Palm Springs to New York via Dallas, and was traveling first class with an emotional support 16 lb Cairn Terrier. I was asked to renew the AA form signed by my doctor 48 hours before the flight. I had been doing this for the last 4 years. I sent the completed form 3 days before the flight I got an email back saying they needed the date the therapist was licensed not the date it expired and the name of her business. I emailed back that she was in private practice and gave the date she was licensed. The day of my flight, I checked in for my flight and was asked for a copy of the service animal form, which I presented and was issued boarding passes, with a stopover in Dallas. When I got to Dallas and boarding the flight to NY with my dog, I was pulled aside and told I couldn't board the flight. Now I had my boarding pass, my suit cases were on the plane, and my little dog was in tow. I said "What, you've got to be kidding?". This very rude employee brusque told me he wanted to my paperwork, which I gave to him. He told me I couldn't board the flight because I needed a letter from my doctor with her letterhead and I didn't have it. I told him I was never asked for that, just the AA form. He said the only way I could board the flight was to pay $250. I said I would if this would help expedite and we could sort it out later. Then he told me then I would need a dog carrier to board the plane, which I didn't have as this wasn't required for emotional support animals. I told him this was not right, I had followed the online requirements and showed him my AA form and my emails with the SAC (Special Assistance Coordinator). I asked him to call his supervisor, which he did. All of this took about 30 minutes. Now the plane was fully boarded and he was not going to let me on this flight. Seconds before the flight left, finally his supervisor agreed I could get on the plane. The doors were now locked to the hallway and he couldn't open them, he was having a meltdown, until another employee who had the gate opener helped him out. I was literally overwhelmed and terrorized (create and maintain a state of extreme fear and distress in (someone)

Dallas to Maui. The service in first class going over to Maui Hawaii was very good on June 15, 2018. However, the service coming back to DFW on June 23,2018 was very bad. I would say the people sitting coach had better service. I had a staff member that must hate her job because they acted as if it was a bother to answer any questions. The meal was very under par, I was served a vegetable dish that consisted of a plate of rice and 2 peas and 2 cubes of sweet potatoes. I will be rethinking my next flight with this airline again

Santa Ana to Phoenix. Poor communication. Changed the gate without an announcement. Then the flight was delayed to wait for a flight attendant to get to work. At least keep us informed, up to date, and not sitting in a plane for too long. We were clearly seen with dollar signs above our heads, and taken for granted. Just poor communication all around. As the very base level of customer service is communication. If you can't handle that properly, the rest is diminished and meaningless.

Charlotte to Greenville. Most unreliable airline I have ever used. 9 out of 10 times that I have used American Airlines, there are multiple delays with no explanation and they will keep pushing back the departure times until they finally tell you the flight is cancelled. I will fly them only out of necessity. Don't bank you hopes of them to get you to your destination on time. It can be so frustrating flying with them.

Phoenix to Omaha. This company was absolutely amazing. My mom has cancer and was going thru a ton of pain but we made it to our original flight. Still in pain they had a wheel chair for her and got her on the plane first to make her comfortable. When we got her off the plane they had a wheel chair for her and took us to baggage and even helped with getting her to the restroom. Both Phoenix and Omaha employees went over and beyond. I will use them always going forward.

Philadelphia to Eria. I purchased tickets for my daughters to fly to Arizona to attend their grandfathers funeral. Everything was fine for the flight to Arizona, it's the return flight where the problems started. My daughters informed me there connecting flight from Philadelphia to Erie, PA had been cancelled due to excessive air traffic. When I called customer service to inquire what was going on I was greeted like this "yeah this is Mike". Seriously this is how a business has there customer service answer the phone. Customer service was no help at all and basically told me he could not do anything. Well so much for customer service. He wasn't outright rude but made me feel I was the idiot for calling to ask questions. Anyway my daughters asked at the airport what was going on and were told they would need to find a hotel for the night since their connecting flight was cancelled. No reason just cancelled. I read a bunch of these reviews and have come to the conclusion that it doesn't matter what I write no one at American Airlines is going to read this or care. They got their money and that's all that matters. I will never book another flight with them even if it's free. This company is a joke.

Miami to Baltimore. Worst customer service ever. I lost my flight after asking 3 employees to help me check in time due to the line size, which was due to cancelled flights. All of them not only refused to help, but were sarcastic and rude. Then couldn't make to the next flight because it was full and AA wanted me to pay to reschedule for the next day or just stay another 8 hours waiting for the stand by again. Absurd customer service and policies.

New York JFK to Charlotte. The customer service for this airline was unspeakable, I tried to speak to the supervisor at the time to see why I was not able to attend the flight I paid for, and she disrespectfully said "I already told you whats going on with your flight" however I did not speak of my flight to her before. Apart from the fact that she spoke to me in a very disrespectful manner, she also attended another group of 30 while she was helping me out. I also overheard one of the guys working in the counter telling a customer that the flight was already packed, so I am assuming that the reason why they were not letting me attend my flight was be cause my flight was oversold. On the other hand I was getting multiple different reasons why i was not able to attend, because I called the airline and they told me my carryon was too big.

Miami to Minneapolis. This was my first and last time flying American Airlines. I was scheduled to depart from MIA Friday at 5:40pm to land in Charolette where I then had a direct flight back to MSP. My scheduled arrival time in MSP was 12:20am Saturday. We started the boarding process where group 1 was starting to board. Then an announcement was made that there was a flat tire on the plane and they needed an hour to replace the tire. Half hour later we had a weather delay, no big deal its weather not their fault. After the weather cleared the work on the tire never started and another announcement was made that they needed an hour to fix the tire. These series of delays caused connection issues with other travelers and my connection was now in jepordy. After the repairs were made and driving around on the runway we finally departed at 9:40pm. We landed in Charolette around 1045pm, my flight to MSP left 20 min before I landed. After talking with an employee about needing to get home I had to spend the night in a questionable hotel that American Airlines paid for and gave me a $12 meal voucher. I arrived at the hotel at 12:30am (Same time I should have landed back home). Instead of having a direct flight from CLT to MSP I had to fly to ORD at 9:40am then land at MSP by 3:05pm. No issues flying to ORD (I was shocked), but now another issue with the plane. After the plane arrived from Las Vegas we started boarding again by calling group 1 then announcing we had to delay because of fluid leaking in the engine. Another delay of 1 hour. The announced that the plane had to be decommissioned and a new plane had to be brought in as a replacement. We finally took off from ORD around 3pm (Again the same time I should have been home). All the delays and setbacks caused my fees in the parking ramp to skyrocket. My overall experience with American Airlines was horrible. I have never been part of so many delays and questioned the overall safety of planes by one fleet. If a plane landed that had fluid leaking in an engine shouldn't that have set off an alarm? Why would they try and board knowing there was an issue on the plane? Also the on flight entertainment is the same level as Spirit airlines, there is none. Only if you want to burn through you phone battery which is an extremely valuable resource when flying American Airlines and can't call your family to tell them you are delayed...again. Overall I would pay extra money to fly a different airlines.

Tampa to Nashville via Charlotte. First and foremost when I booked my flight, I booked it so I would leave out of my home city Sarasota/Bradenton. I was to leave at 5:00 on a Friday morning. At 10:30 p.m. on Thursday I get a text that my flight has been cancelled. Of course I immediately call AA and am told it will take one and half to two hours before I even get a return call. I wait for about an hour and try again. Rather than giving me the call back option this time, they recognize my number and ask me to hold. I do so for about 45 minutes. Eventually I get a customer service representative and my only option is to fly out of Tampa airport the next morning. They initially had me rebooked on a 10:30 a.m. Flight from Tampa but by the time I got into Nashville and then drove two hours to where my daughter lives, all of Friday would have been wasted. So I rebooked on a 5:00 a.m. Flight, getting into Nashville at the same time I would have if my Sarasota flight hadn't been cancelled. By this time it's 1:00 or so in the morning. That leaves me about an hour's worth of sleeping time before I have to get up and leave for the Tampa airport. While I made the flight on time and the customer service representative was very helpful in getting me on that flight, the fact remains I had to drive an hour to the airport and park my car whereas if I had left from Sarasota like I normally do, I would have used Uber and not incurred $90 in parking fees (plus two hours of driving time and tolls). American Airlines refuses to reimburse me. If I had missed my flight you can be sure I wouldn't have gotten a refund or any other courtesy. All I want is a refund of the parking fees. That's not too much to ask.

Syracuse to Denver. Worst experience ever. They should not be allowed to stay in business. If any other business in America treated their customers like I was treated today they would be out of business. Don't fly American airlines or especially their regional PSA.

Baltimore to Miami. We have had to sit on the runway for over an hour and climbing after being told by the captain it would be 10 minutes outside the gate with zero ability to enter the airport, the airline is completely disorganized when it comes to weather. The passengers are super frustrated and the airline has no solution for departing the passengers. This is a horrible way to spend a Friday evening when people are going to a tourist destination like Miami and then caged up because there are no solution minded people at the airport who are capable of Moving empty planes from gates to depart paying passengers in order to save money on gas. Really awful- and all at the customers expense.

Da Firenze a Seattle via Charlotte. Sono molto deluso dall'americano stamattina. Avevo un volo alle 5:50 da Firenze e proprio nel bel mezzo dell'imbarco hanno cancellato il nostro volo, il che mi ha fatto perdere il volo in coincidenza per Seattle. Il modo sconsiderato in cui il personale lo gestisce ha peggiorato le cose, sostanzialmente dicendo che o guidi verso CLT o forniranno Uber ma non assicureranno che perderemo il nuovo volo programmato. Inutile dire che mi manca un altro volo lungo il percorso e arrivare qui dovendo passare ancora una volta attraverso la TSA, quindi rimandare a rappresentanti del servizio clienti ancora più difficili è stato un incubo. Mi viene detto che il mio volo delle 16:00 potrebbe essere ipervenduto ecc. E non c'è un altro volo fino a molto più tardi o anche domani mi fa così arrabbiare che posso piangere. Di solito non mi lamento perché volo 2 o 3 volte al mese e capisco che le cose accadono, ma i problemi di manutenzione o i problemi dell'equipaggio sono esclusivamente sotto il controllo di American Airlines, il modo in cui gestiscono queste condizioni è principalmente lasciato al personale e riflette la loro compagnia . Ma queste persone sono così scortesi e non mi interessa, penso che tornerò a Delta dopo questo

Philadelphia to Athens. I have realised that US airlines are in no way near any of the european or other international airlines in terms of in flight service and quality. Especially with American Airlines an airline that I have used time and again, only in order to avoid transit airports, this can be the only choice for a direct flight to Athens from Philly. The Airbus aircraft was perfect and the flight was very good with minor turbulence however somehow I felt unhappy with cabin staff with the exception of a greek speaking steward. Dinner was below average for such a long flight, (10 hours) and so was the miserable "breakfast" just before landing. Hardly did cabin staff ever pass to collect garbage and once when I complained, the guy looked at me as if he wanted to kill me. Courtesy is almost unknown. Likewise the situation in the toilets was beyond any description.

Cleveland to Charlotte. Customer service was absolutely horrible, arguing with other members in front of customers, didn't apologize, flight was over booked. Was given a choice. Either get rebooked to a later flight with no forewarning or take your chances and if you can't get in tough luck? That's not how business works and I wasn't accommodated for anything. I'll never fly American again that's a fact. Work on your customer service and employee screenings. It's not the customer's job to figure it out if I want take a chance on getting on a flight.

Baltimore to Minneapolis via Charlotte. I was enjoying my first time flying first class until I reached my layover in Charlotte and found my connecting flight to be delayed - as if my layover wasn't already long enough. I try to go to customer service to rebook and the line is way down the terminal. Then I call customer service on the phone but was disconnected because of the high call volume. I look at the departures going to MSP to see an earlier departure that I was willing to pay $70 to jump on, but was denied because I checked baggage in Baltimore. This delay has caused so much inconvenience. You would think AA would take care of their loyalty members. I have another trip booked with them next Monday and I think after that it's to start considering other options.

Dallas to Lubbock. For years I have turned a blind eye with the many small problems of the airline: comfortless, no food, delays, and so on. However, my last flight was too much. They cancelled a flight with no reason given (the weather was excellent in all the route). I was told to call a hotel (Motel 6 DFW North) to pick me up for the night, but they never came. Then, I called American Airlines's customer service but the person answering refused to help me with calling the hotel. At the end, I was left the whole night at the airport. By the way, I had purchased insurance and it was not honored. I am just giving two stars because a manager in the morning kindly helped reprogramming my flight.

Columbus to Charlotte. Customer service was horrible. Traveled with my toddler and had little to no help with guidance and questions. All of the workers had very bad attitudes and made my daughter and I very uncomfortable. Never will fly with them again, I thought frontier was bad but I had the worst experience of my life yesterday with American Airlines. and our flight got delayed a couple of times.

Baltimore to Boise. Absolutely terrible. First flight was delayed for over an hour so we missed our connecting flight, so we also missed our Grandfathers funeral viewing. Was supposed to go from BWI to Phoenix. Got stuck in Pheonix had to go to Salt Lake City then Boise What should have been 8 hours turned into 16. Then they lost our luggage, and thats just getting to our destination. Trying to get home our plane was delayed once again missed our connecting flight got stuck in Arizona overnight. Didn't offer food or a hotel had to pay out of pocket. Then we have another flight the next morning - canceled. Then we get a flight to Chicago where we found out our new connecting flight we were not booked. Staff at Chicago O'Hare was incredibly rude. Like unbelievably. I want someone to do their job I'm paying you to do it. If they cant do their job find someone who can. I'm not paying thousands of dollars for this poor service. Still in Chicago hope they dont screw up the last flight. But they have not impressed me so far.

Chicago to Orlando. My family will never be using American Airlines again. First off, we get to the airport and everyone has bags that meet the 22x14x9 guidelines, in fact 2 of the 3 bags were under that. We had to pay $25 extra per bag for 2 of them because they were the small wheely bags instead of duffel bags. There was a woman working who was very unhelpful and rude and the other staff was just standing around when the kiosk wasn't working to get our tickets. On my sister's return flight, they charged $50 for her bag and there was ample room for it under the seat. She doesn't even carrying a purse so this was literally all she had. We still have 2 return flights on Tuesday, but I am sure there will be some fiasco since American Airlines seems to hide their fees and guidelines everywhere! I would definitely not recommend this airline.

New York JFK to Milan. I'll start by saying that the flight itself was smooth. Aside from that, the flying experience with this airline was terrible. Sadly, I had a seat in cattle class for which I paid $60 extra just to reserve with no obvious benefit. American has now crammed 9 seats into what was clearly meant to be an 8 seat row. The seats themselves are significantly narrower and flimsy. To say the seats are uncomfortable is an understatement. And this was a transatlantic flight. The food was barely edible, came with terrible plastic utensils and was basically thrown at us. Service was totally disinterested. Having flown economy class on Lufthansa last year, the whole experience was shocking. Never, never again. American airlines should be ashamed.

Jacksonville to New York via Charlotte. Sleeping at CLT: How a flight crew laid waste our $4105.29 AA Vacation family weekend in New York. First, when I wrote my review of our AA Vacations Westin La Paloma trip in April, I didn't think that experience could be worsted (opposite of bested), so I didn't expect to be writing about another superlatively bad AA Vacation again, at least not so soon. I was wrong. The moral of this story is if you value the welfare of your family, your time and your money, don't rely on AA Vacations. But I've gotten ahead of myself. Here's our story. Things went beautifully on the first leg of what was to have been a fun family weekend in NY to celebrate the end of our son's school year. We sped through TSA pre, were greeted courteously at the gate and took our assigned seats in first class on AA1937. After a pleasant short flight to Charlotte, we connected to AA1981 bound for LaGuardia. When that flight didn't push away on time, the captain announced from the flight deck that a "minor technical issue" would hold us up briefly. I followed a running text stream of delay notices from AA on my phone. Then I received the dreaded notice of cancellation. Oddly, the flight crew were still telling us that the â€œtechnical issueâ€ was in the process of being fixed. Specifically, the pilot advised that the copilot had flown too many hours to legally make the trip to NY and AA was on the hunt for a replacement. When I told the cabin attendant that the flight had been cancelled, she passed the news to the captain who, nonplussed, announced that "apparently American Airlines notifies passengers of cancellations before telling its crew." We were advised to deplane and come back at 7:00 a.m. the following day. I immediately called AA Vacations who had booked as part of our package non-refundable tickets for activities and events on Saturday. I got a terrific agent named Kristen who nimbly booked us on a flight to Newark. She even kept our first-class status! All we had to do was run the mile from the end of terminal C to the end of terminal B before the flight's scheduled 10:00 departure. We needn't have run. The flight to Newark was delayed due to a mechanical. First 11:00, then 12:00, then vouchers to Starbucks, then 1:00, then first class boarded, then we were told to deplane, then 2:00

Harrisburg to Philadelphia. This was the worst experience my husband and I have ever had with an airline. There were consistent delays which then caused issues for us to get to our connecting flight in Philadelphia which was the only flight to Athens. We were given incorrect information by the ticketing department on the phone, which then led us to drive the entire way to Philadelphia. We have spent hours trying to figure out a way to be compensated and they have the worst customer service! We will never use American Airlines again and be sure to make our family and friends aware of the issues they have caused us.

Chicago to Rome. American Airlines, never again to be used on a Transatlantic flight. My partner and I traveled from Chicago to Rome on April 8 and even though I was charged almost $200 more to just be seated together on the only few two seaters available on this flight, it turned out to be the trip from purgatory. The FA kept hitting my shoulder all night long as she was walking back and forth down the aisle. I asked if they had a self service cart with juice/water and snacks in the back galley like most civilized airlines do and the told me it was not the case on this flight. The meal was really average nothing to scream alleluia about. I will truly go out of my way to avoid this company when flying overseas. Why do they call this aircraft the Dreamliner? Perhaps if you travel in First or Business - not so in regular economy. Very disappointed indeed.

Miami to Denver. Our flight was to leave Miami at 8:25 p.m on a Monday. When we got to our gate at 7:00 p.m we were told to go to another gate halfway across the airport because our gate had be changed. After going to the new location and seating there for about 45 minutes. We were told that our gate had changed back to the gate we were originally at. Finally we get to board the plane around 8:45. The pilot comes over the intercom and says "please take your seats we only have 6 minutes before our crew times out. At this time the fuel truck had just pulled up. After about 10 minutes. The pilot comes back on the intercom and tells us that the crew has times out and that they were not going to be able to fly us to Denver. So the pilots exit the plane. 10 minutes later the flight attendant come on and say "we have a new fight crew on the way and we will be leaving as soon as they get here". 45 minutes to an hour later after sitting on the plane she comes back on only to tell us that there was no new crew and we needed to get off the plane. Now it's around 11:00-11:30. After about an hour of sitting at the gate waiting to hear of any updates. They tell us there's a new fight crew is coming and we would be leaving as soon as they arrived and do there pre-flight checks. So around 12:15 or so the new crew starts to arrive. First 1 pilot, 20 minutes later another pilot, 20 later the engineer comes. I guess. They tell us we will be taking off shortly. Around 1:15 a.m or so. They tell us the the flight attendants have now timed out and our flight would be canceled. It's funny now but not really. They then tell us that we have to go back to the other gate to rebook our flights out. Luckily for us we knew the number to call for rebooking. So we were able to get on the next flight out at 6:45 Tuesday morning. My wife tells me today that they gave her a $100 voucher. Not only did they know they were going to have to cancel the flight but they were dishonest and didn't have to decency to tell us the truth. I have not received anything for them nor do I care to. I will drive to Miami the next time if that's the only way to get there is on American Airlines. They can keep their $100 voucher. If you have any other means of getting to where you need to be I would suggest you use it.

San Diego to Savannah. American Airlines is by far the worst experience I have ever encountered. My flight has been delayed for approximately 4 hours and I am still waiting. If you have to schedule a flight I recommend not to use this one.

Dallas to Kona. A surprisingly wonderful experience. It is truly a pleasure to say that everything about this trip was wonderful. They are using an internationally configured aircraft on this seasonal route so the comfort factor was a wow.The attendants were lovely, gracious and efficient in a way that I haven't experienced with American in a long time. The catering wasn't great but sufficient and due to the aircraft type wi-fi and entertainment were top notch. Although I know it is not common on American to experience a ride like this so I felt it was important to give credit where it was due.

Chicago to Kansas City. I am sitting in Chicago waiting on your flight attendants because of poor planning on American Airlines part. Can we not just leave without them? I do not need a drink. The issue is is that they just don't care how you inconvenience others who have to just willing deal with their obvious ability to plan ahead. It is Chicago - American Airlines have hundreds of flights going in and out can't they have backup flight attendent!!

Philadelphia to Tucson. Absolutely disappointed with trip. First flight was cancelled with only minimal time to reschedule. Rescheduled flight was delayed and captain did horrible job or letting us know and was unsympathetic. No real answers provided except it may be an additional hour stuck on a full flight with a 80% humidity and no air. Completely unprofessional and even de-boarding instructions were less than helpful. You have found a way to lose me not only as a business client but also a personal customer - good job American Airlines.

Dallas to Baton Rouge. It takes a lot for me to go through the effort of placing a review, but American Airlines has worked hard for this one. I travel regularly from Baton Rouge to Dallas Fort Worth and they are consistently late. Not only are they late they will push a scheduled flight so many times at the last minute it eliminates the option of catching an earlier flight that somehow seems to take off before you thought it was scheduled to depart after your original time. Only a true professional at screwing things up to pull this off. I do this for work because it's the most convenient geographical departure and arrival cities, other than that American Airlines is a complete disappointment.

Los Angeles to London. I am an Executive Platinum (Emerald) member with American Airlines since 1999, and I have flown 1.5m miles with American Airlines. During my flight from Los Angeles to London Heathrow on Jun 5 (Flight AA108) I requested a cabin crew member to have a family member who was seated in 21A to be relocated to a vacant seat close to me. The cabin crew member was very accommodating and personally relocated my family member, Midway through the flight. The purser of the flight approached me an accused me of having the family member illegally take an unoccupied seat. I tried to explain that I requested the relocation with a cabin crew member and she obliged. The Purser continued to be abusive. I advised her that I will be addressing through all means possible.

Dallas to Oklahoma City. Normally I don't have problems with AA but after a recent flight cancellation for the second part of my journey, I am very disappointed with the lack of action on AA's part. My flight which was on a Sunday night was delayed for about 1.5-2 hours at which point it was canceled due to â€œmaintenance issues.â€ I called AA to reschedule a flight and also went to the customer service desk. I had a flight for work the following morning at 10:30 so I really need to get back. I asked if I could be put on another flight, switched airlines, flown out somewhere else and come from another place, get a rental car, or anything that would allow me to make my flight the next morning. They said there is nothing I can do but I can go online and get a reimbursement which should be up to $120. I ended up having to rent a car and drive from DFW to OKC which cost me about $260. I have tried to be reimbursed for this cost but the best I got was a $100 voucher that has to be used within a year. The problem is very few flights cost $100 so this forces me to fly AA again within the year and have to pay them more out of my pocket so this is in no way a reimbursement but a way for them to secure my future business. Additionally the refund for my flight was $79. I feel like I did everything I could possibly do on my part to remedy the situation and felt very helpless. I am very disappointed with AA's effort on this and I will likely turn to other airlines in the future. The next flight I could have flown on was at 4:50 the following night and AA never offered to put me in a hotel so I would have just had to stay in the airport or pay for a hotel anyways. AA created a situation where I was at their mercy for assistance and did nothing.

London to Los Angeles. The worst flight by far. Once everyone was on the plane the pilot announced that we were gonna load on more people who's flight had been cancelled earlier in the day and that this would make us at least an hour late. Once in air the food was horrendous and inedible and that's coming from someone who never complains about food. Apart from that the bathroom was extremely untidy with sticky toilet seats. When we landed we were once again waiting and were stuck on the runway for approximately 50 minutes. This all resulted in us being over 2 hours late. If you have another option then choose that one because American is a disgrace. I usually fly with Lufthansa and this was really a downgrade.

Pittsburgh to Dallas/Fort Worth. I was so happy and impressed with American Airlines Service. I was traveling from Pittsburgh, PA to Lubbock, Texas. I have never flown before and neither have my children. I have a daughter with special needs and disabilities so I made sure to make all the necessary phone calls to airports, TSA, and American Airlines. I wanted to make sure everything would go smoothly for her and that we wouldn't have any problems with her special needs during flights and her special needs stroller.
